        <div class="grid-container" id="main-content">
                            <div class="grid-x grid-margin-x">
    <div class="small-12 medium-12 large-9 cell">

<div class="freeStarFragrantica" align="center" data-freestar-ad="__300x300" id="fragranticacom_perfume_incontent_1" v-pre>
</div></div></div><div class="grid-x grid-margin-x grid-margin-y"><div class="cell small-6"><likes-rating :perfume_id="3865" chart="show" type-chart="small-chart" colors="retro"></likes-rating></div><div class="cell small-6"><seasons-rating :perfume_id="3865" chart="show" type-chart="small-chart" colors="retro"></seasons-rating></div><div class="small-12 medium-6 text-center" style="max-height: 50px"><div itemprop="aggregateRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/AggregateRating" itemscope><p class="info-note">Perfume rating&nbsp;<span itemprop="ratingValue">4.17</span>&nbsp;out of&nbsp;<span itemprop="bestRating">5</span> with&nbsp;<span itemprop="ratingCount" content="8918">8,918</span> votes<meta itemprop="reviewCount" content="936"/></p></div></div></div><div class="grid-x grid-margin-x grid-margin-y"><div class="cell small-12" itemprop="description" v-pre><p><b>Philosykos Eau de Parfum</b> by <b>Diptyque</b> is a Woody Aromatic fragrance for women and men. <b>Philosykos Eau de Parfum</b> was launched in 1996. The nose behind this fragrance is Olivia Giacobetti. Top notes are Fig Leaf and Fig; middle notes are Green Notes and Coconut; base notes are Fig Tree, Woody Notes and Cedar. </p><p class="reviewstrigger" style="font-size: smaller; color: #83a6c4">Read about this perfume in other languages: <a href="https://www.fragrantica.de/Parfum/Diptyque/Philosykos-Eau-de-Parfum-3865.html" target="_blank" rel="noopener">Deutsch</a>,  <a </fragram-photos-wrapper><div class="cell small-12"><div class="grid-x grid-padding-y" id="pyramid"><div class="cell"><div style="display: flex; flex-direction: column; justify-content: center; text-align: center; background: white;"><div class="strike-title"><span>Perfume Pyramid</span></div><pyramid-switch :perfume_id="3865"><pyramid-notes title="Main Notes According to Your Votes"></pyramid-notes><h4 style="margin-top: 0.5rem"><b>Top Notes</b></h4><pyramid-level notes="top"><div style="display: flex; justify-content: center; text-align: center; flex-wrap: wrap; align-items: flex-end; flex-direction: row; padding: 0.5rem;"><div style="margin: 0.2rem; display: flex; justify-content: center; flex-direction: column; text-align: center; opacity: 1; position: relative;"><div><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/sastojci/t.150.jpg" style="width: 5rem;"></div><div><a href="https://www.fragrantica.com/notes/Fig-Leaf-150.html"><span class="link-span"></span></a>Fig Leaf</div></div><div style="margin: 0.2rem; display: flex; justify-content: center; flex-direction: column; text-align: center; opacity: 1; position: relative;"><div><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/sastojci/t.247.jpg" style="width: 4.3rem;"></div><div><a href="https://www.fragrantica.com/notes/Fig-247.html"><span class="link-span"></span></a>Fig</div></div></div>
</pyramid-level><h4 style="margin-top: 0.5rem"><b>Middle Notes</b></h4><pyramid-level notes="middle"><div style="display: flex; justify-content: center; text-align: center; flex-wrap: wrap; align-items: flex-end; flex-direction: row; padding: 0.5rem;"><div style="margin: 0.2rem; display: flex; justify-content: center; flex-direction: column; text-align: center; opacity: 0.98726063291633; position: relative;"><div><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/sastojci/t.318.jpg" style="width: 3.9rem;"></div><div><a href="https://www.fragrantica.com/notes/Green-Notes-318.html"><span class="link-span"></span></a>Green Notes</div></div><div style="margin: 0.2rem; display: flex; justify-content: center; flex-direction: column; text-align: center; opacity: 0.94590744661054; position: relative;"><div><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/sastojci/t.138.jpg" style="width: 3.6rem;"></div><div><a href="https://www.fragrantica.com/notes/Coconut-138.html"><span class="link-span"></span></a>Coconut</div></div></div>
</pyramid-level><h4 style="margin-top: 0.5rem"><b>Base Notes</b></h4><pyramid-level notes="base"><div style="display: flex; justify-content: center; text-align: center; flex-wrap: wrap; align-items: flex-end; flex-direction: row; padding: 0.5rem;"><div style="margin: 0.2rem; display: flex; justify-content: center; flex-direction: column; text-align: center; opacity: 0.91133789209637; position: relative;"><div><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/sastojci/t.431.jpg" style="width: 3.375rem;"></div><div><a href="https://www.fragrantica.com/notes/Fig-tree-431.html"><span class="link-span"></span></a>Fig Tree</div></div><div style="margin: 0.2rem; display: flex; justify-content: center; flex-direction: column; text-align: center; opacity: 0.78283876109963; position: relative;"><div><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/sastojci/t.315.jpg" style="width: 2.7rem;"></div><div><a href="https://www.fragrantica.com/notes/Woody-Notes-315.html"><span class="link-span"></span></a>Woody Notes</div></div><div style="margin: 0.2rem; display: flex; justify-content: center; flex-direction: column; text-align: center; opacity: 0.73508893593265; position: relative;"><div><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/sastojci/t.41.jpg" style="width: 2.5rem;"></div><div><a href="https://www.fragrantica.com/notes/Cedar-41.html"><span class="link-span"></span></a>Cedar</div></div></div>

padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1316358">popelkalostincosmos</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2024-12-03">12/03/24 06:17</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>If I dont count the "green" notes, this is a perfect creamy scent. Fig, fig leaves and coconut have such a great harmony. Smells so good, so natural yet rare. Diptyque, you worked well hun!<br />
But.... I smell the green notes, and it makes the scent a bit sour, and i dont like green note in fragrances. I wish there would be a flanker without the green notes, it would've been my signature :(</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="3865"comment_id="2369217"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Diptyque/Philosykos-Eau-de-Parfum-3865.html?ccid=2369217#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent2369019" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(250,247,236,0.81);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:0,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;have&quot;}"></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc2369019" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="cheleine"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1349744"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.1349744.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="cheleine" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Diptyque/Eau-Duelle-Eau-de-Toilette-9241.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.9241.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Eau Duelle Eau de Toilette"title="Eau Duelle Eau de Toilette"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma2369019ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck1x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd2369019" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(250,247,236,0.81); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1349744">cheleine</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2024-12-03">12/03/24 01:04</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>Absolute love. As a greek person this brings back so many memories of innocence and childhood. The smell is very realistic, natural and soothing, almost therapeutic. <br />
The greeness is rounded and smooth in the EDP. <br />
I can feel the creaminess of the fig fruit and the coconut. It is best suited in summer but I love to spray during the cold too because it transports me to sunnier days. It brings out a zen, carefree feeling. <br />
I personally find it similar to the EDT but I prefer the EDP concentration because it feels smoother, more substantial, denser/deeper, slightly sweeter and it lasts longer.<br />
Not a huge fan of the hand and body lotion, maybe it was a batch problem but it smelled weird on me. <br />
Philosykos is a classic for a reason at this point and it will stay this way for years to come.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="3865"comment_id="2369019"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Diptyque/Philosykos-Eau-de-Parfum-3865.html?ccid=2369019#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent2368680" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(249,249,243,0.83);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:0,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;want&quot;}"></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc2364707" class="cell small-2" ><div ><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="HansFrans123"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/2282449"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/himg/o.69247.png" class="comments-avatar"alt="HansFrans123" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Diptyque/Eau-Duelle-Eau-de-Parfum-49100.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.49100.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Eau Duelle Eau de Parfum"title="Eau Duelle Eau de Parfum"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma2364707ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck0x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd2364707" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"><div class="flex-child-shrink" style="background: rgba(250,249,251,0.86); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/2282449">HansFrans123</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2024-11-29">11/29/24 03:06</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>On initial spray, this transported me directly back to picking rings in early spring. Rather than the sweat or sticky internal of the fig, this is very fresh and green, as though youre smelling the tree as a whole. If youve ever climbed a fig tree, this is what it smells like. Devine, only wish it lasted a little longer.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="3865"comment_id="2364707"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Diptyque/Philosykos-Eau-de-Parfum-3865.html?ccid=2364707#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(250,247,236,0.74); padding: 0; border: none; margin: 0;"><!-- Tag ID: fragranticacom_perfume_incontent_6 -->
<div class="freeStarFragrantica" align="center" data-freestar-ad="__300x300" id="fragranticacom_perfume_incontent_6" v-pre>
</div></div><div id="parent2360980" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(250,247,236,0.74);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:4,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:1,&quot;summer&quot;:1,&quot;autumn&quot;:1,&quot;day&quot;:1,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:3,&quot;sillage&quot;:1,&quot;gender&quot;:&quot;unisex&quot;,&quot;relation&quot;:null}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="4"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc2360980" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="BandmanMrBandman"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/2081102"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.2081102.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="BandmanMrBandman" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Dolce-Gabbana/K-by-Dolce-Gabbana-56358.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.56358.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="K by Dolce & Gabbana"title="K by Dolce & Gabbana"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma2360980ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck0x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd2360980" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(250,247,236,0.74); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/2081102">BandmanMrBandman</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2024-11-25">11/25/24 12:37</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>Such a refreshing and different green scent, im not partial to fig much but its such a nice change of pace compared to other green scents that begin to blend together and smell the same. Its very lush and realistic, slightly fruity and also slightly bitter with a creamy coconut in the background that becomes more apparent over time, not bottle worthy to me but still pleasantly surprised by how different it stands to me very memorable if you want a more unique green scent this one is up there only wish it lasted just a little longer</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="3865"comment_id="2360980"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Diptyque/Philosykos-Eau-de-Parfum-3865.html?ccid=2360980#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent2355931" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(249,249,243,0.8);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:0,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;have&quot;}"></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc2355931" class="cell small-2" ><div ><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="Beebeebeeps"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/2230346"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/himg/o.69247.png" class="comments-avatar"alt="Beebeebeeps" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma2355931ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck0x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd2355931" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"><div class="flex-child-shrink" style="background: rgba(249,249,243,0.8); One of the best executed scents. A leafy, fresh, and airy scent. Settled beautiful on my skin.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="3865"comment_id="2355931"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Diptyque/Philosykos-Eau-de-Parfum-3865.html?ccid=2355931#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent2352400" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(248,249,236,0.85);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:4,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:null}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="4"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; Weirdly nostalgic for me. <br />
<br />
Surprisingly pleasant wearing experience as well. Leaves a clean &amp; unique scent trail.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="3865"comment_id="2352400"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Diptyque/Philosykos-Eau-de-Parfum-3865.html?ccid=2352400#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent2352365" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(247,244,242,0.73);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:0,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:null}"></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/153205">Yessamin</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2024-11-17">11/17/24 05:03</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>Very strong fig oriented fragrance. To me its fig leaf that stands out for a long time. <br />
Very linear fragrance. It develops and turns a bit more creamy with coconut.<br />
If you are into green fragrances it might be worth a try. However, I would not consider this to be a safe blind buy</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="3865"comment_id="2351790"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Diptyque/Philosykos-Eau-de-Parfum-3865.html?ccid=2351790#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent2350836" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(250,247,236,0.72);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:5,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;have&quot;}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="5"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc2350836" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="thelighthouse_"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1469958"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.1469958.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="thelighthouse_" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Diptyque/Philosykos-Eau-de-Parfum-3865.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.3865.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Philosykos Eau de Parfum"title="Philosykos Eau de Parfum"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma2350836ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck1x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd2350836" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(250,247,236,0.72); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1469958">thelighthouse_</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2024-11-16">11/16/24 07:13</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>A physical store finally opened near me and i ran to smell this gem. I am absolutely floored by the first sniff. It opens with this beautifully juicy fig, so juicy it brings up memories of a freshly-picked peach from my grandpa's backyard, that subtle and not-too-sweet scent on it's fuzzy skin. The fig leaf is the true star though: gorgeous green, beautifully herbal. There is something comforting and free in this frangrance. Something that puts me at ease, even in a dark hour. (And it doesn't hurt that the lady working there was the softest, most open and kind person i had ever had the pleasure of interacting with)</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="3865"comment_id="2350836"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Diptyque/Philosykos-Eau-de-Parfum-3865.html?ccid=2350836#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent2350583" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(250,249,251,0.72);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:2,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;had&quot;}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="2"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc2350583" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="JuliaToothFairy"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/2026472"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.2026472.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="JuliaToothFairy" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma2350583ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck1x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd2350583" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(250,249,251,0.72); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/2026472">JuliaToothFairy</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2024-11-15">11/15/24 23:31</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>Philosykos smells like ripe, but not very ripe, fresh figs. They are ripe, but not sweet yet. A young tree's green branch. A little bit of coconut water.<br />
A very interesting, nostalgic smell. A scent pulled out of a childhood memory of living in a small village.<br />
Even if this is a unique perfume, a beautiful smell, I would not buy to wear it. When it dries down, it has a main hyperrealistic fig leaves note, a green leaf that smells bitter when you break it in half. This bitterness makes it not wearable for me.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="3865"comment_id="2350583"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Diptyque/Philosykos-Eau-de-Parfum-3865.html?ccid=2350583#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent2349983" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(249,249,243,0.89);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:4,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:1,&quot;summer&quot;:1,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:1,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:3,&quot;sillage&quot;:1,&quot;gender&quot;:&quot;female_unisex&quot;,&quot;relation&quot;:null}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="4"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc2349983" class="cell small-2" ><div ><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="Nataliemespino"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/2026248"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.2026248.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="Nataliemespino" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma2349983ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck0x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd2349983" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"><div class="flex-child-shrink" style="background: rgba(249,249,243,0.89); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/2026248">Nataliemespino</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2024-11-15">11/15/24 10:01</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>This is DS&amp;Durgas Debaser, but a tad sweeter and more wearable in my opinion. Its heavily green at first, and settles into a pleasant, calming scent with a touch of coconut. Its definitely a very green fig rather than a sweet, ripe one. If youre a fan of green scents, this one is for you.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="3865"comment_id="2349983"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Diptyque/Philosykos-Eau-de-Parfum-3865.html?ccid=2349983#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent2347816" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(255,253,234,0.78);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:5,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;want&quot;}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="5"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc2347816" class="cell small-2" ><div ><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="livsyk"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/2288660"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.2288660.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="livsyk" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma2347816ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck2x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd2347816" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"><div class="flex-child-shrink" style="background: rgba(255,253,234,0.78); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/2288660">livsyk</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2024-11-13">11/13/24 12:25</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>Fresh, green, and realistic. It smells like a memory but not one that I can pinpoint.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="3865"comment_id="2347816"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Diptyque/Philosykos-Eau-de-Parfum-3865.html?ccid=2347816#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent2344213" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(254,252,238,0.72);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:0,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:null}"></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc2344213" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="garnet soda"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/2267000"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.2267000.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="garnet soda" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Byredo/Mojave-Ghost-27040.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.27040.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Mojave Ghost"title="Mojave Ghost"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma2344213ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck1x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd2344213" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(254,252,238,0.72); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/2267000">garnet soda</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2024-11-10">11/10/24 08:02</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>Very mulchy, with a faint sense of petrichor. It smells like garden disposals - which, I dont know is the correct term, but when my parents would groom the trees and bushes in the backyard they would throw the cuts of branches, twigs, and leaves into a green garbage bin. Philosykos, to me, is very reminiscent of tha bin. I got shot to memories of sticking my head inside it as a kid immediately upon first whiff. <br />
I dont mean this in a bad way. Its a fascinating scent, although I dont think its something Id ever wear. Its effective as a storyteller, or a transporter into nature. I might enjoy this as a room spray, but wouldnt use with just any guest. Not exactly a crowd pleaser.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="3865"comment_id="2344213"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Diptyque/Philosykos-Eau-de-Parfum-3865.html?ccid=2344213#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent2344045" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(254,252,238,0.81);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:5,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:1,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:4,&quot;sillage&quot;:2,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:null}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="5"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; Reminds me of summer in southern Italy, so nostalgic. Wonder if any men wear this because I think this scent is quite unisex.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="3865"comment_id="2344045"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Diptyque/Philosykos-Eau-de-Parfum-3865.html?ccid=2344045#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent2343824" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(250,249,251,0.85);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:5,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;want&quot;}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="5"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc2332974" class="cell small-2" ><div ><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="broken_biscuits"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/2265584"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/himg/o.69247.png" class="comments-avatar"alt="broken_biscuits" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma2332974ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck0x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd2332974" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"><div class="flex-child-shrink" style="background: rgba(249,249,243,0.72); That's a beautiful scent in and of itself, but I found that it didn't blend with my natural scent-- like, there was the "me" smell, and then, separately, the grass smell. Maybe I'll try layering it with a molecular scent or a musc to hopefully get something a little more blend and longevity. It may not be for me, but not because I dislike it, per se.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="3865"comment_id="2332974"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Diptyque/Philosykos-Eau-de-Parfum-3865.html?ccid=2332974#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent2331125" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(249,249,243,0.85);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:3,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:null}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="3"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc2326879" class="cell small-2" ><div ><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="PaleSeptember"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/2137927"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/himg/o.69247.png" class="comments-avatar"alt="PaleSeptember" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma2326879ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck1x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd2326879" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"><div class="flex-child-shrink" style="background: rgba(250,249,251,0.83); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/2137927">PaleSeptember</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2024-10-25">10/25/24 00:01</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>This is such a rich, verdant scent. The prominent note is fig leaf as opposed to the fig fruit itself. There is a certain juicy creaminess to it that points to fig fruit, but by no means does this smell overly sweet like fig pudding. Its like morning dew dripping off a young fruit carrying with it the trees essence. Or like a meadow with that grassy hay-like smell that is mildly sweet and comforting.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="3865"comment_id="2326879"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Diptyque/Philosykos-Eau-de-Parfum-3865.html?ccid=2326879#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent2323561" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(248,249,236,0.82);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:5,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;have&quot;}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="5"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc2323561" class="cell small-2" ><div ><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="saramariah"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/39745"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.39745.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="saramariah" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Byredo/Mojave-Ghost-27040.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.27040.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Mojave Ghost"title="Mojave Ghost"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma2323561ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck0x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd2323561" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"><div class="flex-child-shrink" style="background: rgba(248,249,236,0.82); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/39745">saramariah</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2024-10-22">10/22/24 03:25</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>Oh this is so similar to Italian summer fig from Body Shop that I had and adored before they discontinued it :( But this one is even better, its really high quality. The fig in it also reminds me of Ralph Lauren Hot.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="3865"comment_id="2323561"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Diptyque/Philosykos-Eau-de-Parfum-3865.html?ccid=2323561#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent2322163" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(255,253,234,0.83);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:4,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:1,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:1,&quot;night&quot;:1,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:null}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="4"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc2322163" class="cell small-2" ><div ><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="BLove345"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1972393"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/himg/o.69247.png" class="comments-avatar"alt="BLove345" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/By-Rosie-Jane/Dulce-79146.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.79146.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Dulce"title="Dulce"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma2322163ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck0x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd2322163" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"><div class="flex-child-shrink" style="background: rgba(255,253,234,0.83); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1972393">BLove345</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2024-10-20">10/20/24 16:13</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>This smells like a being in a field catching fireflies. It's very green, but comforting. There's no ozone or solar notes, but I wouldn't be surprised if they were actually in there.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="3865"comment_id="2322163"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Diptyque/Philosykos-Eau-de-Parfum-3865.html?ccid=2322163#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent2314363" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(247,244,242,0.81);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:3,&quot;winter&quot;:1,&quot;spring&quot;:1,&quot;summer&quot;:1,&quot;autumn&quot;:1,&quot;day&quot;:1,&quot;night&quot;:1,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:&quot;unisex&quot;,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;have&quot;}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="3"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc2314363" class="cell small-2" ><div ><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="jenaissequois"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1819864"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/himg/o.69247.png" class="comments-avatar"alt="jenaissequois" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Diptyque/L-Eau-Papier-78658.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.78658.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="L'Eau Papier"title="L'Eau Papier"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma2314363ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck0x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd2314363" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"><div class="flex-child-shrink" style="background: rgba(247,244,242,0.81); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1819864">jenaissequois</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2024-10-13">10/13/24 09:20</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>I can't make up my mind about this one. Was given a bottle after og owner didn't like it. It's very figgy, as to be expected, with a creaminess in the middle. It's very unisex. I've never reached for it either and can't quite figure out why.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="3865"comment_id="2314363"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Diptyque/Philosykos-Eau-de-Parfum-3865.html?ccid=2314363#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent2313570" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(247,244,242,0.78);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:4,&quot;winter&quot;:1,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:1,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:3,&quot;sillage&quot;:3,&quot;gender&quot;:&quot;male_unisex&quot;,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;have&quot;}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="4"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc2313570" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="Atticlovebuzz"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1730270"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.1730270.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="Atticlovebuzz" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/L-T-Piver/Heliotrope-Blanc-11560.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.11560.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Heliotrope Blanc"title="Heliotrope Blanc"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma2313570ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck3x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd2313570" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(247,244,242,0.78); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1730270">Atticlovebuzz</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2024-10-12">10/12/24 14:21</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>This is going to be entirely biased because the Ozark mountains have blessed me with a taste for green and woody scents, but this one is different than the others. I love when I smell a specific perfume and go into a daze just thinking about the memory it evokes. This is waking up before the sun rose to hike with my grandfather through a thicket of forestry. This is swearing he was as old and wise as every cedar tree that he brushed against. This is just beyond my window and ten years ago over a hill all at once.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="3865"comment_id="2313570"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Diptyque/Philosykos-Eau-de-Parfum-3865.html?ccid=2313570#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent2312608" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(249,249,243,0.75);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:5,&quot;winter&quot;:1,&quot;spring&quot;:1,&quot;summer&quot;:1,&quot;autumn&quot;:1,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:3,&quot;sillage&quot;:2,&quot;gender&quot;:&quot;unisex&quot;,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;have&quot;}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="5"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc2312608" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="amberflash"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/95168"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.95168.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="amberflash" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Roja-Dove/Innuendo-17975.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.17975.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Innuendo"title="Innuendo"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma2312608ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck2x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd2312608" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(249,249,243,0.75); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/95168">amberflash</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2024-10-11">10/11/24 15:46</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>I recently did a side-by-side comparison of this and its modern challenger, Debaser, on Debaser's Fragrantica page.  Philosykos, of course, won.  It's a classic for a reason, and modern imitators often fall short*.<br />
<br />
I remember first smelling this in 2004, some twenty years ago, when my flatmate took me to the Diptyque shop near Liverpool Street to buy a new bottle of Eau Lente (her favourite).  I had never smelled anything like it before.  The scent of fig, at least the one I had known all of my life, was of the fruit -- and although there was a touch of sweetness in Philosykos, the fig sap and leaf smell here was completely new to me. It was so green and so magical!  I think I bought a bottle of Philosykos and a bottle of Opone that year, and I used the bottle of Opone up first - not because I liked it better but because I didn't want Philosykos to run out.  I felt that I had to make it last, so that I could smell it whenever I felt sad, when I needed to remember that there were good things in the world too.<br />
<br />
Eventually, my bottle did run out. And I moved onto other perfumes. But in the intervening years I've thought about Philosykos a lot, and I finally bought a new bottle this month. About the juice itself, I'm not sure I can say much more than has already been said by others.  There's a sweetness in the top notes which burns off quickly, but otherwise Philosykos is a fairly linear, very green fig leaf-fig wood/sap scent with milky coconut and a cedar base.  The EDT is (of course) a bit lighter than the EDP, which in turn lasts longer; but neither are overpowering and the cedar and fig complement each other throughout, although with fig firmly at the center at all times.  It's not a super performer.  Even the EDP is gone, for the most part, after 3-4 hours on my skin.  But as I said: it's a classic for a reason.  It's breathtakingly beautiful. And it was the first of its kind.  If you have never smelled it, you must.<br />
<br />
*the exception to the "imitators fall short" rule is Saltworks "French Fig" which is a near dupe to Philosykos but at an increased intensity.  I've reviewed it separately but if you like Philosykos, get the travel size of "French Fig" for cheap and you won't be disappointed.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="3865"comment_id="2312608"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Diptyque/Philosykos-Eau-de-Parfum-3865.html?ccid=2312608#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent2307238" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(247,244,242,0.86);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:4,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:null}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="4"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc2307238" class="cell small-2" ><div ><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="perfumelover17"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1729880"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.1729880.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="perfumelover17" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Juliette-Has-A-Gun/Mmmm-40461.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.40461.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Mmmm..."title="Mmmm..."></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma2307238ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck4x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd2307238" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"><div class="flex-child-shrink" style="background: rgba(247,244,242,0.86); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1729880">perfumelover17</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2024-10-06">10/06/24 17:59</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>On morning runs, I used to pass a certain fig tree every day. It was the smallest moment of bliss during a god-awful time (I despised cross country), and it always made me smile. The smell of the wet wood, the leafy green, and the milky fruit is perfectly encapsulated in this fragrance.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="3865"comment_id="2307238"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Diptyque/Philosykos-Eau-de-Parfum-3865.html?ccid=2307238#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent2306683" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(250,249,251,0.8);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:5,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:1,&quot;summer&quot;:1,&quot;autumn&quot;:1,&quot;day&quot;:1,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:2,&quot;sillage&quot;:1,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;have&quot;}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="5"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc2306683" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="tildeofficial"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/2263574"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.2263574.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="tildeofficial" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Diptyque/Eau-Rose-Eau-De-Parfum-71661.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.71661.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Eau Rose Eau De Parfum"title="Eau Rose Eau De Parfum"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma2306683ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck2x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd2306683" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(250,249,251,0.8); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/2263574">tildeofficial</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2024-10-06">10/06/24 07:24</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>When I first smelled the sample at the local boutique I didn't like it mostly because I was taken aback by how damn green it was. Then I bought L'eau Papier since it's what everyone is buying these day and the sneaky sales associate slipped in a 5ml sample gift of Philosykos. She did the right thing because along the week I kept on trying the scent and slowly and slowly I became obsessed with it. Now, I got a full EDP bottle and waiting for a bottle of EDT. I'm that obsessed.<br />
<br />
Nothing else I need to add about the scent, it's fig to a tee. The dry down on my skin hovers between the line of creamy fig &amp; coconut milk.<br />
<br />
The performance leaves a lot to be desired though, it projects for around 2 hours before becoming a skin scent, seems to be the case with most Diptyque scents.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="3865"comment_id="2306683"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Diptyque/Philosykos-Eau-de-Parfum-3865.html?ccid=2306683#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent2306139" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(250,249,251,0.79);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:5,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:1,&quot;summer&quot;:1,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:1,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:3,&quot;sillage&quot;:2,&quot;gender&quot;:&quot;unisex&quot;,&quot;relation&quot;:null}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="5"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc2306139" class="cell small-2" ><div ><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="Ferra_Verto"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1160884"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/himg/o.69247.png" class="comments-avatar"alt="Ferra_Verto" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Elizabeth-Taylor/Diamonds-and-Rubies-1705.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.1705.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Diamonds and Rubies"title="Diamonds and Rubies"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma2306139ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck1x2"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd2306139" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"><div class="flex-child-shrink" style="background: rgba(250,249,251,0.79); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1160884">Ferra_Verto</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2024-10-05">10/05/24 16:01</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>Testing my sample; smells like a whole fig tree after a summer rain. Full blast of the tree's leaves, the skin of the ripened fruit, and the wood of the tree. There's some coconut in the backdrop and something that vaguely reminds me of freshly mowed grass. <br />
Perfect for warm/hot weather, I don't think this would shine as much in the cold. I have to bring the crook of my elbow to my nose to detect after a few hours.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="3865"comment_id="2306139"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Diptyque/Philosykos-Eau-de-Parfum-3865.html?ccid=2306139#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent2305867" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(247,244,242,0.88);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:4,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:null}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="4"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc2305867" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="angelbeast"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1970878"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.1970878.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="angelbeast" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma2305867ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck4x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd2305867" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(247,244,242,0.88); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1970878">angelbeast</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2024-10-05">10/05/24 11:32</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>Stunning - must be smelt to be believed. How they managed to bottle a lush, freshly-pruned, dripping wet fig leaf is beyond me. I'm getting very tired of the hordes of people spamming the exact same "WHO would want to wear this?!!??!" line in the comments of literally every photorealism scent. Just use some imagination. Imagine this on a temperate, rainy day, making you feel like you're melting into the air. Imagine this in a stuffy, hot train compartment, a cool little oasis on your wrist just for you. Imagine an eccentric gardener bringing the scent of clean foliage along with her into any building she enters. Philosykos is truly unique, and a piece of art: have a little fun with it!</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="3865"comment_id="2305867"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Diptyque/Philosykos-Eau-de-Parfum-3865.html?ccid=2305867#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent2305805" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(249,249,243,0.86);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:2,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:1,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:null}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="2"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="3865"comment_id="2305805"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Diptyque/Philosykos-Eau-de-Parfum-3865.html?ccid=2305805#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent2303581" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(250,245,242,0.84);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:4,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:1,&quot;summer&quot;:1,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:1,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;have&quot;}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="4"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc2303581" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="SilkyWoods"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1507238"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.1507238.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="SilkyWoods" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Giardini-Di-Toscana/Bianco-Latte-64757.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.64757.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Bianco Latte"title="Bianco Latte"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma2303581ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck2x2"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd2303581" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(250,245,242,0.84); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1507238">SilkyWoods</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2024-10-03">10/03/24 09:51</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>This perfume needs to sit for sooooo long before it gets good. I bought mine a year ago and havent been able to wear it for the first few months. It was so green and sharp, way too much for me. <br />
<br />
But now after all these months just sitting on my shelf, its starting to turn into the smooth, rich, juicy scent i fell in love with from the tester bottle. <br />
<br />
Dont give up to easy if you bought it and it smells nothing like the tester. It needs time.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="3865"comment_id="2303581"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Diptyque/Philosykos-Eau-de-Parfum-3865.html?ccid=2303581#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent2299790" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(249,249,243,0.74);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:0,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:null}"></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%;
