I appreciate the artistry of this fragrance and it is probably one of the best and most realistic fig scents but i dont want to smell like i just come from mowing the lawn.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="3865"comment_id="2299790"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Diptyque/Philosykos-Eau-de-Parfum-3865.html?ccid=2299790#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent2295958" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(255,253,234,0.89);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:3,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:null}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="3"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc2295958" class="cell small-2" ><div ><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="emgailba"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1394495"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.1394495.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="emgailba" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/DS-Durga/Debaser-29736.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.29736.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Debaser"title="Debaser"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma2295958ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck0x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd2295958" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"><div class="flex-child-shrink" style="background: rgba(255,253,234,0.89); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1394495">emgailba</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2024-09-26">09/26/24 12:40</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>I love fig scents--I think they give upscale, hotel lobby vibes. This one is a bit milky on my skin, and there's a soapy quality that reminds me of hand lotion. I prefer dryer, woodier fig scents, so I'll stick to Essential Parfumes Fig Infusion and DS&amp;Durga's Debaser.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="3865"comment_id="2295958"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Diptyque/Philosykos-Eau-de-Parfum-3865.html?ccid=2295958#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent2295459" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(247,244,242,0.9);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:3,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:2,&quot;sillage&quot;:1,&quot;gender&quot;:&quot;unisex&quot;,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;have&quot;}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="3"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc2295459" class="cell small-2" ><div ><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="RASQTR"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/2098476"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.2098476.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="RASQTR" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma2295459ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck0x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd2295459" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"><div class="flex-child-shrink" style="background: rgba(247,244,242,0.9); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/2098476">RASQTR</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2024-09-26">09/26/24 02:58</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>Clear green herbal fragrance</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="3865"comment_id="2295459"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Diptyque/Philosykos-Eau-de-Parfum-3865.html?ccid=2295459#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent2290965" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(250,245,242,0.87);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:0,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;have&quot;}"></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc2290965" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="honeymonsoon"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/2262417"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.2262417.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="honeymonsoon" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma2290965ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck3x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd2290965" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(250,245,242,0.87); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/2262417">honeymonsoon</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2024-09-21">09/21/24 19:48</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>You're laying against the trunk of a ripe fig tree, reading your favourite book. It starts to drizzle. You stay exactly as you are. <br />
<br />
This is my favourite fig scent - a truly photorealistic fig tree. You will be rather disappointed if you expected a milky, sappy fig fruit. This is predominantly green, vegetal and woody, laced with distinct petrichor. It's a bit sweeter in the drydown, lactonic and honeyed, as if you've finally picked one fruit off the tree and ripped it open. I don't get any coconut. It's a somewhat quiet, introspective and melancholy fragrance. If you like DSD's Debaser, this is its less outgoing, more soft-spoken sibling. <br />
<br />
The performance is truly awful. You'd be lucky to get a couple of hours before it evaporates into a weak skin scent. Despite this, it's been my favourite rainy weather perfume for years.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="3865"comment_id="2290965"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Diptyque/Philosykos-Eau-de-Parfum-3865.html?ccid=2290965#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent2289268" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(247,244,242,0.71);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:2,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:null}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="2"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc2289268" class="cell small-2" ><div ><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="fairymeist"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1269119"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.1269119.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="fairymeist" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Maison-Martin-Margiela/By-the-Fireplace-31623.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.31623.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="By the Fireplace"title="By the Fireplace"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma2289268ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck2x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd2289268" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"><div class="flex-child-shrink" style="background: rgba(247,244,242,0.71); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1269119">fairymeist</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2024-09-20">09/20/24 09:26</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>This smells like straight up green fig, freshly ripped from the tree, too hyper realistic for me. I dont want to be smelling like a fig to be honest</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="3865"comment_id="2289268"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Diptyque/Philosykos-Eau-de-Parfum-3865.html?ccid=2289268#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent2288028" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(250,247,236,0.76);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:4,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:1,&quot;summer&quot;:1,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:1,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:3,&quot;sillage&quot;:1,&quot;gender&quot;:&quot;unisex&quot;,&quot;relation&quot;:null}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="4"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc2288028" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="XGR04"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1725959"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.1725959.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="XGR04" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Areej-Le-Dore/Atlantic-Ambergris-II-71320.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.71320.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Atlantic Ambergris II"title="Atlantic Ambergris II"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma2288028ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck1x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd2288028" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(250,247,236,0.76); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1725959">XGR04</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2024-09-19">09/19/24 07:32</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>Diptyque's Philosykos EDP is one of the few mainstream niche warm-weather scents that I truly enjoy, to be blatantly honest. Compared to most of the other fig-forward scents I've encountered, Philosykos takes a far more holistic approach in its representation of the accord - instead of replicating the same, cloying fig accord that seems almost ubiquitous in this current day and age, it is multifaceted and delicate.<br />
<br />
The fragrance opens with the brisk green freshness that one would smell whilst in the vicinity of freshly cut grass (the latter, which I must admit, I do not typically enjoy). With some persistence on my part, it soon begins to bloom, revealing a fleshy, juicy fig accord, reminiscent of what one may experience when biting into an actual fig. Thankfully, this never becomes cloying or overbearing, which I am especially grateful for, given my overall dislike of sweet fragrances. <br />
<br />
I'm perfectly fine with the fact that other than what I've described, there's really not much more to Philosykos. It serves its purpose as a springtime/summertime fragrance far better than most of the other offerings within the genre, which is a success in itself.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="3865"comment_id="2288028"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Diptyque/Philosykos-Eau-de-Parfum-3865.html?ccid=2288028#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent2286355" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(250,245,242,0.78);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:0,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;have&quot;}"></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc2286355" class="cell small-2" ><div ><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="wiamra"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/2241603"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/himg/o.69247.png" class="comments-avatar"alt="wiamra" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma2286355ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck0x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd2286355" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"><div class="flex-child-shrink" style="background: rgba(250,245,242,0.78); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/2241603">wiamra</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2024-09-17">09/17/24 18:13</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>Imagine you're crushing fig leaves: green, wet, fresh with slight fruitiness. By minutes it turns milky and creamy from the coconut. Sadly after 2 hours I barely smell anything on my skin. :(<br />
<br />
I actually like the smell, but it doesn't last long, so unfortunate.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="3865"comment_id="2286355"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Diptyque/Philosykos-Eau-de-Parfum-3865.html?ccid=2286355#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent2284810" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(247,244,242,0.88);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:2,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:null}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="2"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc2284810" class="cell small-2" ><div ><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="TaeBKK"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1727971"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.1727971.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="TaeBKK" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma2284810ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck0x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd2284810" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"><div class="flex-child-shrink" style="background: rgba(247,244,242,0.88); Not my favorite, but can understand why people like it.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="3865"comment_id="2284810"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Diptyque/Philosykos-Eau-de-Parfum-3865.html?ccid=2284810#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent2283963" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(254,252,238,0.85);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:5,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:1,&quot;summer&quot;:1,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:1,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:2,&quot;sillage&quot;:1,&quot;gender&quot;:&quot;unisex&quot;,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;have&quot;}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="5"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc2283963" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="emechevs"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/2179930"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.2179930.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="emechevs" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Obvious/Une-Pistache-84607.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.84607.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Une Pistache"title="Une Pistache"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma2283963ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck1x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd2283963" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(254,252,238,0.85); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/2179930">emechevs</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2024-09-15">09/15/24 15:15</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>I expected a photorealistic fig tree, but I was not prepared for the fond spring and summertime memories that came flooding back!  Wow, this fragrance is a masterpiece.  If you have spent any time around fig trees, this is worth trying.  As other have mentioned, it doesnt last particularly long.  However, Im willing to overlook this fact and re-spray from the full bottle I bought cuz goodness, I love this stuff.  Stemmy, green, milky sap, jammy fruit, peppery wood - its a whole fig tree experience in a bottle. </p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="3865"comment_id="2283963"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Diptyque/Philosykos-Eau-de-Parfum-3865.html?ccid=2283963#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent2283156" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(255,253,234,0.79);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:3,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:1,&quot;summer&quot;:1,&quot;autumn&quot;:1,&quot;day&quot;:1,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:1,&quot;sillage&quot;:1,&quot;gender&quot;:&quot;female_unisex&quot;,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;want&quot;}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="3"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; Thankfully I only got a 5ml sample.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="3865"comment_id="2283156"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Diptyque/Philosykos-Eau-de-Parfum-3865.html?ccid=2283156#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent2282445" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(248,249,236,0.89);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:0,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:null}"></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="3865"comment_id="2282445"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Diptyque/Philosykos-Eau-de-Parfum-3865.html?ccid=2282445#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent2278179" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(248,249,236,0.89);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:0,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;have&quot;}"></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; <br />
I have Premier Figuier in the lotion version that smells rather similar.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="3865"comment_id="2278179"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Diptyque/Philosykos-Eau-de-Parfum-3865.html?ccid=2278179#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent2276594" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(250,245,242,0.84);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:2,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:null}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="2"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; It's fresh, yet warm and robust and a little headache-y, similar to the headache some white flowers give some people.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="3865"comment_id="2276594"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Diptyque/Philosykos-Eau-de-Parfum-3865.html?ccid=2276594#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent2276564" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(254,252,238,0.73);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:4,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:1,&quot;summer&quot;:1,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:1,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;have&quot;}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="4"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc2276564" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="henderson_the_rain_king"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/2064019"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.2064019.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="henderson_the_rain_king" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Jo-Malone-London/Ginger-Biscuit-Cologne-2023-87708.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.87708.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Ginger Biscuit Cologne (2023)"title="Ginger Biscuit Cologne (2023)"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma2276564ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck1x2"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd2276564" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(254,252,238,0.73); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/2064019">henderson_the_rain_king</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2024-09-09">09/09/24 01:31</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>opening super pronounced GREEN.<br />
then sweet, coconut, but not in a drugstore body lotion way. in a... less sweet, more expensive way. the wood base note expertly grounds and balances out everything else while remaining almost imperceptible itself, i guess.<br />
i don't really know what figs smell or taste like, so there's that.<br />
a good, "i appreciate elegant, expensive things" signalling fragrance for the warm months, or all year round for someone who's head over heels in love with green notes in perfume.<br />
EDP, however performance very fleeting on my skin.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="3865"comment_id="2276564"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Diptyque/Philosykos-Eau-de-Parfum-3865.html?ccid=2276564#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent2273902" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(255,253,234,0.9);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:0,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:null}"></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc2273902" class="cell small-2" ><div ><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="Kaylovely"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1329847"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.1329847.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="Kaylovely" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Alexandre-J/Zafeer-Oud-Vanille-22361.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.22361.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Zafeer Oud Vanille"title="Zafeer Oud Vanille"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma2273902ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck0x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd2273902" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"><div class="flex-child-shrink" style="background: rgba(255,253,234,0.9); Very disappointing because I like it and it is unique.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="3865"comment_id="2273070"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Diptyque/Philosykos-Eau-de-Parfum-3865.html?ccid=2273070#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent2271051" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(249,249,243,0.82);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:4,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:null}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="4"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc2271051" class="cell small-2" ><div ><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="Zoe22"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1086069"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.1086069.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="Zoe22" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma2271051ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck2x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd2271051" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"><div class="flex-child-shrink" style="background: rgba(249,249,243,0.82); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1086069">Zoe22</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2024-09-04">09/04/24 05:22</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>This is nice. Very realistic, the opening smells like wet grass, or the liquid that oozes out of a broken branch. The greenness isn't sharp, it's smooth and kind of comforting. Creamy and woody notes come through as it dries down and the green notes become more subtle. Not the strongest, it doesn't stick around for long.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="3865"comment_id="2271051"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Diptyque/Philosykos-Eau-de-Parfum-3865.html?ccid=2271051#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent2270097" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(250,249,251,0.78);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:0,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:3,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:&quot;unisex&quot;,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;have&quot;}"></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc2270097" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="mawarmusfirah"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1699241"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/himg/o.69247.png" class="comments-avatar"alt="mawarmusfirah" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma2270097ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck1x2"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd2270097" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(250,249,251,0.78); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1699241">mawarmusfirah</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2024-09-03">09/03/24 07:58</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>Possibly the worst performing fragrance I have (2-3 hours max) however the scent itself is very unique. A hyper realistic fig fragrance - not just the fruit but you get the whole tree. Pretty literal imo. Very green, earthy, tad creamy. I get the slightest hint of coconut in the middle. For me its like walking into a fig garden after it rains - wet and dewy. Not exactly summery Id say. Stunning but polarising. Another one with a similar vibe is Matiere Premiere Parisian Musc, better performance for sure.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="3865"comment_id="2270097"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Diptyque/Philosykos-Eau-de-Parfum-3865.html?ccid=2270097#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent2268490" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(254,252,238,0.7);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:2,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:null}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="2"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc2268490" class="cell small-2" ><div ><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="jakepacheco"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1786693"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.1786693.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="jakepacheco" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Maison-Alhambra/Berlinetta-84594.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.84594.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Berlinetta"title="Berlinetta"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma2268490ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck1x2"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd2268490" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"><div class="flex-child-shrink" style="background: rgba(254,252,238,0.7); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1786693">jakepacheco</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2024-09-01">09/01/24 16:57</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>The most realistic green Ive encountered, but I personally dont want to smell like Ive been rolling around in grass. Great if you want to smell like literal figs and twigs, but Im not getting any other notes that make it worth the price.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="3865"comment_id="2268490"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Diptyque/Philosykos-Eau-de-Parfum-3865.html?ccid=2268490#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent2265158" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(254,252,238,0.79);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:5,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:1,&quot;summer&quot;:1,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:1,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:2,&quot;sillage&quot;:1,&quot;gender&quot;:&quot;female&quot;,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;have&quot;}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="5"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc2265158" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="StrangeTrails"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/2138040"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.2138040.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="StrangeTrails" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Atelier-Cologne/Santal-Carmin-25292.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.25292.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Santal Carmin"title="Santal Carmin"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma2265158ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck3x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd2265158" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(254,252,238,0.79); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/2138040">StrangeTrails</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2024-08-29">08/29/24 16:16</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>This opens with the most hyper-realistic green note I've ever smelled, like you've gone around snapping branches and stems in the garden. Fig leaf? Maybe, but if you've ever pulled dandelions or thistles and smelled that milky fluid that comes out of the stems when you snap them, it smells more like that to me. Definitely polarizing! If you're looking for something "fresh" without citrus or beachy salt, this would probably fit the bill. It has that earthy dewy lake water vibe, in a bright and clean way without being acidic.<br />
<br />
Once it dries down, that fades - you get a very creamy, juicy fresh fig. It has a lactonic milky sweetness to it, but I don't get coconut. Absolutely ethereal and beautiful, at least to me. And then, three hours later, it's gone  <br />
<br />
I get maybe 3-4 hours of longevity out of it, and I tried the EDP. In those fours hours, it hugs close to the skin and never projects far, and has next to no sillage, so it's really a "me" scent that is office safe in my opinion - folks have to be VERY close to smell you. For the price it's an expensive one to reapply, but I don't mind because the scent itself is so beautiful. It's so very light, it's not surprising it has less lasting power to me, but if pricepoint is a concern there are other fig scents out there for better price points. They just don't necessarily have the ethereal vibe or the artistry that this one has!<br />
<br />
Oh, and I get absolutely NO coconut vibes and thank god for that.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="3865"comment_id="2265158"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Diptyque/Philosykos-Eau-de-Parfum-3865.html?ccid=2265158#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent2259143" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(249,249,243,0.9);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:4,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:1,&quot;summer&quot;:1,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:3,&quot;sillage&quot;:2,&quot;gender&quot;:&quot;unisex&quot;,&quot;relation&quot;:null}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="4"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc2259143" class="cell small-2" ><div ><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="ethanrrs"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/2181530"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.2181530.gif" class="comments-avatar"alt="ethanrrs" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma2259143ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck1x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd2259143" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"><div class="flex-child-shrink" style="background: rgba(249,249,243,0.9); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/2181530">ethanrrs</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2024-08-24">08/24/24 01:31</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>the quintessential fig, the one i test all others against. to be fair there is a bit of a coconutty vibe like with a lot of fig accords, but it isnt as strong as it is in something like debaser. There's a strong vegetal quality and an overall watery feeling on top of the subtle sweetness. <br />
<br />
feels like it's on the more restrained and weaker side, which is fine but not ideal for me</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="3865"comment_id="2259143"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Diptyque/Philosykos-Eau-de-Parfum-3865.html?ccid=2259143#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent2258984" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(250,245,242,0.8);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:0,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:null}"></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc2258984" class="cell small-2" ><div ><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="martamachado77"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1862678"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.1862678.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="martamachado77" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Caudalie/Soleil-des-Vignes-68558.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.68558.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Soleil des Vignes"title="Soleil des Vignes"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma2258984ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck0x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd2258984" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"><div class="flex-child-shrink" style="background: rgba(250,245,242,0.8); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1862678">martamachado77</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2024-08-23">08/23/24 20:14</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>Absolutely delicious. sweet but just right. I have fig trees at my grandmother's house and I can smell the leaf, which is different from the fruit, with a green touch. I can even taste the milk from the freshly picked fig. it's fantastic. Hyper realistic. I feel like I'm picking figs at my grandmother's house.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="3865"comment_id="2258984"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Diptyque/Philosykos-Eau-de-Parfum-3865.html?ccid=2258984#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent2258552" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(248,249,236,0.81);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:4,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:1,&quot;summer&quot;:1,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:1,&quot;night&quot;:1,&quot;longevity&quot;:3,&quot;sillage&quot;:2,&quot;gender&quot;:&quot;unisex&quot;,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;have&quot;}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="4"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc2258552" class="cell small-2" ><div ><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="MeriseGuashe"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/2228006"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.2228006.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="MeriseGuashe" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Elie-Saab/Le-Parfum-12258.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.12258.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Le Parfum"title="Le Parfum"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma2258552ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck1x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd2258552" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"><div class="flex-child-shrink" style="background: rgba(248,249,236,0.81); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/2228006">MeriseGuashe</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2024-08-23">08/23/24 11:14</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>I just bought this one today and loved it. Very unique, well blended, full of life yet peaceful. Normally i don't prefer green dominated fragrances but this is so good, makes you feel like you are sitting under a fig tree, surrounded by different green plants, summer breeze radiates the scent of fig trees and fresh cut grasses. What a beautiful experience. The only bad part is it doesnt last long, i must say that.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="3865"comment_id="2258552"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Diptyque/Philosykos-Eau-de-Parfum-3865.html?ccid=2258552#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent2255893" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(255,253,234,0.84);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:2,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:1,&quot;summer&quot;:1,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:1,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:&quot;female_unisex&quot;,&quot;relation&quot;:null}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="2"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc2255893" class="cell small-2" ><div ><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="Vorpal"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1821877"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.1821877.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="Vorpal" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Parfums-de-Marly/Percival-51037.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.51037.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Percival"title="Percival"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma2255893ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck1x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd2255893" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"><div class="flex-child-shrink" style="background: rgba(255,253,234,0.84); It reminds me of the Hainan Yeshu coconut milk ().<br />
<br />
If I were to smell this on someone, I'd be more inclined to think it was a beauty product rather than a high-end fragrance, as you get the same scent from every coconut conditioner or hydrating cream out there.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; Should put my money elsewhere but I would love to have a bottle just because I love how this fragrance smells.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="3865"comment_id="2254310"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Diptyque/Philosykos-Eau-de-Parfum-3865.html?ccid=2254310#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent2254164" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(250,245,242,0.89);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:0,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:3,&quot;sillage&quot;:1,&quot;gender&quot;:&quot;unisex&quot;,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;have&quot;}"></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc2254164" class="cell small-2" ><div ><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="EmsFrag16"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/2220697"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/himg/o.69247.png" class="comments-avatar"alt="EmsFrag16" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Etat-Libre-d-Orange/You-Or-Someone-Like-You-43531.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.43531.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="You Or Someone Like You"title="You Or Someone Like You"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma2254164ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck2x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd2254164" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"><div class="flex-child-shrink" style="background: rgba(250,245,242,0.89); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/2220697">EmsFrag16</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2024-08-19">08/19/24 09:41</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>My favorite green scent as a fig lover. Hyper realistic fig tree and leaf scent, not sweet at all on the top notes. Dry down is closer to the skin on me, with the lactonic and cedar coming through in a fresh manner still. Perfect Mediterranean summer dream! A bit pricey though.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="3865"comment_id="2254164"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Diptyque/Philosykos-Eau-de-Parfum-3865.html?ccid=2254164#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent2250163" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(255,253,234,0.7);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:5,&quot;winter&quot;:1,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:1,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:4,&quot;sillage&quot;:2,&quot;gender&quot;:&quot;female&quot;,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;have&quot;}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="5"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc2250163" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="wishforfreedom"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/998115"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.998115.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="wishforfreedom" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Diptyque/Philosykos-Eau-de-Parfum-3865.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.3865.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Philosykos Eau de Parfum"title="Philosykos Eau de Parfum"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma2250163ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck3x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd2250163" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(255,253,234,0.7); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/998115">wishforfreedom</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2024-08-15">08/15/24 07:33</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>I'm so interested why some people dislike Diptyque so much. I agree that many of their fragrances don't smell so original and don't keep on some peoples skin, and don't get me started on the candles. However, to me, Philosykos is extremely unique, interesting, pleasant and also has decent sillage and staying power. In my opionion it's also very versatile, In summer it smells very creamy and just fresh enough to be not cloying, in autumn it obviously fits the harvest vibe, even in winter I kind of enjoy it because of it's milky sweet notes. I think it just meshes well with my personal skin chemistry. I also named my cat after this lol!</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="3865"comment_id="2250163"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Diptyque/Philosykos-Eau-de-Parfum-3865.html?ccid=2250163#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent2241650" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(248,249,236,0.89);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:5,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:null}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="5"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc2241650" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="oliveeyes94"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/2057320"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/himg/o.69247.png" class="comments-avatar"alt="oliveeyes94" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma2241650ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck4x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd2241650" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(248,249,236,0.89); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/2057320">oliveeyes94</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2024-08-07">08/07/24 07:26</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>What to say that hasn't already been said countless times before?<br />
<br />
Well, I'm not familiar with the smell of real fig trees, or their fruit for that matter. What I do know is the smell and taste of dried figs, but as these don't feature here, I'll leave out all mentions of a fig.<br />
<br />
The EDP &amp; EDT open in very similar ways - they could be mistaken for sprays from exactly the same bottle. What we get is a very sharp (but not acidic) note of green. Real green. The kind of green that's left on your fingers and momentarily floats around in the air when you snap a leaf in half. There is no soil, no dirt, just the smell of freshly severed leaves.<br />
<br />
What happens next is what I truly love. A kind of airy sophistication takes over. That initial sharp twang of greenery dissipates and is replaced with a wet, airy, very mildly fruity, lactonic vibe. But this is not heavy cream, or even semi-skimmed milk. This is almost like a coconut water sense of milkiness, without the actual smell of coconuts. A very vague sweetness giving the impression of something with a milky body. Sure is hard to pin down with words, it's more of a feeling when wearing this - super smooth in the dry down with an airy sophistication.<br />
<br />
Lets talk about performance, I compared the juice from my EDP bottle with that of an EDT sample from a reliable source. The smells are almost identical, especially at the beginning. The EDP simply carries more weight, has more heft and pronounces more strongly that central note: greenery fading and something with more body and substance taking over. This aspect fell a little flat in the EDT. <br />
<br />
Both projected quite well for the first 1 hour, the EDP continued with good projection into the second, whilst the EDT slowed down. Going for a walk 3 hours after spraying - holding my EDT left hand up gave very little sillage, I had to get real close to smell it. Opposingly, using the same arm-in-front-of-face method, the right arm EDP held its ground and I was met with it's beautiful sillage. Fast forward to 5 hours after spraying - the EDT has completely gone and the EDP remains as an almost-skin scent.<br />
<br />
7 hours after spraying and the EDP, too, has gone. I went for a longish walk in 30C heat &amp; 80% humidity, as well as cooked dinner before the 7 hours were up. In cooler conditions, with less time sweating outside and sweating even more in the kitchen, I'm certain the EDP would break the 10 hour mark. The EDT was weaker throughout so I believe even in more optimal conditions it would still fade much quicker.<br />
<br />
Those who talk about how the EDT and EDP are wildly different fragrances... well, not to my nose. It's simply a matter of profile thickness. As one would expect, the EDP carries more weight and lasts about 3 hours longer with a slightly stronger projection throughout. "More coconut in the EDT/more greenery in the EDP".... I believe such statements are simply an illusion created by the density of each perfume. <br />
<br />
There's no question about it - if you like this smell, the EDP is absolutely the way to go. The initial greenery is more pronounced, the central part of the fragrance has more body and the lactonic notes come through more strongly. It also lasts longer and projects more.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="3865"comment_id="2241650"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Diptyque/Philosykos-Eau-de-Parfum-3865.html?ccid=2241650#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent2241500" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(250,249,251,0.74);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:0,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;have&quot;}"></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc2241500" class="cell small-2" ><div ><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="Micro Atom"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/2215109"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.2215109.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="Micro Atom" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma2241500ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck1x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd2241500" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"><div class="flex-child-shrink" style="background: rgba(250,249,251,0.74); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/2215109">Micro Atom</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2024-08-07">08/07/24 04:08</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>I'm using it for years, definitely the best fig-dominant perfume, in fact, EDT is beautier in terms of scent, but it has 0 performances.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc2239157" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="contristo"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/2064120"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.2064120.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="contristo" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Vilhelm-Parfumerie/Dear-Polly-30928.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.30928.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Dear Polly"title="Dear Polly"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma2239157ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck2x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd2239157" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(254,252,238,0.79); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/2064120">contristo</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2024-08-04">08/04/24 22:52</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>Trying to find the words to write my love letter to Philosykos fresh, green, juicy and dewy in the first bit. Humid lake air facing shady, blooming, sandy fruit trees. Sweet fruit and leaves of the fig [tree], but also fuzzy peach skin to a tee. Set upon a neural woody full bodied canvas. And in the midst of it all you have the yummiest coconut leave in conditioner in?! Im so in love. Its so supple I cant think of a better word Im sorry</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="3865"comment_id="2239157"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Diptyque/Philosykos-Eau-de-Parfum-3865.html?ccid=2239157#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent2238891" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(250,245,242,0.89);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:0,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:null}"></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; This scent is quite literal. I get only fresh fig, then fresh fig and coconut, with a final perfomance by coconut alone. Smelling this on my skin over time felt like an adventure. Not sure I would want to wear this much or at all, but I appreciate its storytelling. <br />

padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc2222336" class="cell small-2" ><div ><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="PerfumeObsessive"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1355132"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/himg/o.69247.png" class="comments-avatar"alt="PerfumeObsessive" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma2222336ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck0x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd2222336" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"><div class="flex-child-shrink" style="background: rgba(254,252,238,0.71); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1355132">PerfumeObsessive</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2024-07-18">07/18/24 09:18</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>It is SUCH a shame what they have done to this masterpiece. It used to be green and full bodied and gorgeous. It became a wet watery mess.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="3865"comment_id="2222336"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Diptyque/Philosykos-Eau-de-Parfum-3865.html?ccid=2222336#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent2217686" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(247,244,242,0.8);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:5,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:1,&quot;summer&quot;:1,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:1,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;have&quot;}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="5"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc2217686" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="bunnoid"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/2108870"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.2108870.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="bunnoid" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma2217686ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck1x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd2217686" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(247,244,242,0.8); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/2108870">bunnoid</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2024-07-13">07/13/24 13:11</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>ohhhh i really like this. it smells like a wet botanical garden at first and the sillage is really good!! im so glad because im sick and tired of these expensive ass perfumes being a close to the skin scent that disappears after 10 min like whats the point seriously!!<br />
its very green and woody but after an hour or so the sweetness comes out and im licherally obsessed. could use a boost of creaminess that could be achieved with layering too!<br />
<br />
edit: Yeah this right here is my bestie. i got the big bottle edp and my wallet hurt a little bit but it is so worth it because i love her. shes green, sweet, and perfect in any season or weather. makes me want to frolick</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="3865"comment_id="2217686"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Diptyque/Philosykos-Eau-de-Parfum-3865.html?ccid=2217686#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent2217057" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(250,247,236,0.83);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:4,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:1,&quot;summer&quot;:1,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:2,&quot;sillage&quot;:1,&quot;gender&quot;:&quot;unisex&quot;,&quot;relation&quot;:null}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="4"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc2217057" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="austinmdpedi"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/2073655"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.2073655.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="austinmdpedi" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma2217057ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck0x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd2217057" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(250,247,236,0.83); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/2073655">austinmdpedi</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2024-07-12">07/12/24 21:28</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>Most realistic stemmy, torn-leaf aroma Ive ever smelled in a fragrance. Incredible. Almost a bark like element. Like you scrape the thin bark with your fingernail and smell. Unfortunately it doesnt move past that for me and with my nose and on my skin I dont get that distinctive milky jammy fig fruit aroma I want. So, super green, fig leaves and bark but none of the fruit. Like all from this brand it is fairly fleeting. So I get 2-3 hours of intimate greenness then its gone.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="3865"comment_id="2217057"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Diptyque/Philosykos-Eau-de-Parfum-3865.html?ccid=2217057#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent2214053" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(248,249,236,0.79);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:1,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:2,&quot;sillage&quot;:1,&quot;gender&quot;:&quot;unisex&quot;,&quot;relation&quot;:null}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="1"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%;
