padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/2136298">synthesaize</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2024-07-10">07/10/24 07:54</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>I dont get why would anyone want to smell like leaves</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="3865"comment_id="2214053"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Diptyque/Philosykos-Eau-de-Parfum-3865.html?ccid=2214053#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent2213556" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(248,249,236,0.83);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:0,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;have&quot;}"></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc2213556" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="vilhelmlin"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/2177884"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/himg/o.69247.png" class="comments-avatar"alt="vilhelmlin" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma2213556ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck1x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd2213556" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(248,249,236,0.83); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/2177884">vilhelmlin</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2024-07-09">07/09/24 20:25</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>Before discovering this fragrance, I had spent several years maintaining and pruning a fig tree in my yard. When fig trees are cut, they ooze a white sap. The fig leaves also have a faint, distinct smell. <br />
<br />
Fast forward and upon my first sample of Philosykos, I was floored by how realistic the smell was. It's interesting to read other comments on this scent because I realized not everyone has direct experience with fig wood and fig leaves. If you are a fan of those smells, this fragrance is the realistic must have. <br />
<br />
The major downside is performance. Very weak sillage and becomes hard to perceive within an hour or two.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="3865"comment_id="2213556"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Diptyque/Philosykos-Eau-de-Parfum-3865.html?ccid=2213556#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent2209274" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(255,253,234,0.89);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:5,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;have&quot;}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="5"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc2209274" class="cell small-2" ><div ><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="vladravenstein"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1857172"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.1857172.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="vladravenstein" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Kayali-Fragrances/Vanilla-28-52616.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.52616.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Vanilla 28"title="Vanilla 28"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma2209274ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck0x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd2209274" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"><div class="flex-child-shrink" style="background: rgba(255,253,234,0.89); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1857172">vladravenstein</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2024-07-05">07/05/24 13:41</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>The OG milky fig tree and sweet, ripe figs, a summer freshie that is easy to wear in hot weather without causing a headache to anyone. It is one of the most used fragrances in my collection. Also smells nearly identical to Figuier Eden by Armani.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="3865"comment_id="2209274"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Diptyque/Philosykos-Eau-de-Parfum-3865.html?ccid=2209274#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent2188958" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(247,244,242,0.79);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:0,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;have&quot;}"></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc2188958" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="nasiav"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1852527"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.1852527.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="nasiav" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma2188958ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck1x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd2188958" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(247,244,242,0.79); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1852527">nasiav</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2024-06-15">06/15/24 06:00</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>Got this one when I was homesick and I can say that it really smells like walking around a plum tree yard in the middle of the summer somewhere in the mediterranean. It smells more like plum leaves to me rather than plum itself. Id probably pair it with something else, maybe with some coconut body spray as well. Its not for everyone, as the green notes are very heavy. Still love wearing it in the spring and summer and it travels me to the greek island i used to visit every summer growing up.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="3865"comment_id="2188958"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Diptyque/Philosykos-Eau-de-Parfum-3865.html?ccid=2188958#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent2186784" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(248,249,236,0.81);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:4,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:1,&quot;summer&quot;:1,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:1,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:1,&quot;sillage&quot;:2,&quot;gender&quot;:&quot;unisex&quot;,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;had&quot;}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="4"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc2186784" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="vminie"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/2128906"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/himg/o.69247.png" class="comments-avatar"alt="vminie" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma2186784ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck0x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd2186784" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(248,249,236,0.81); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/2128906">vminie</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2024-06-13">06/13/24 04:12</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>It really does smell like green leaves or newly cut grass in the opening. The coconut note in the middle is airy and clean, not the creamy type in most "summer" perfumes so it doesn't feel like an incoming headache. It is a mood lifting perfume for me. My only concern is its longevity. It settles into this second skin kind of scent and I feel like (or maybe I am hoping) that people can smell it more on me than I can smell myself (lol that's me hoping). I really like it and I won't mind having a bottle every now and then but when I think about the longevity against the price point, my heart hurts T_T.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="3865"comment_id="2186784"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Diptyque/Philosykos-Eau-de-Parfum-3865.html?ccid=2186784#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent2185828" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(254,252,238,0.8);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:5,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:1,&quot;summer&quot;:1,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;had&quot;}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="5"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; It will completely disappears in one or two hours, very weak performance for me, unfortunately. Just finished a bottle, wouldn't buy again.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="3865"comment_id="2185828"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Diptyque/Philosykos-Eau-de-Parfum-3865.html?ccid=2185828#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent2184300" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(247,244,242,0.8);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:4,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:3,&quot;sillage&quot;:2,&quot;gender&quot;:&quot;unisex&quot;,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;want&quot;}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="4"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc2184300" class="cell small-2" ><div ><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="Lexie_Burke"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1905087"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.1905087.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="Lexie_Burke" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Viktor-Rolf/Good-Fortune-Elixir-Intense-83160.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.83160.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Good Fortune Elixir Intense"title="Good Fortune Elixir Intense"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma2184300ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck0x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd2184300" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"><div class="flex-child-shrink" style="background: rgba(247,244,242,0.8); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1905087">Lexie_Burke</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2024-06-10">06/10/24 17:36</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>Ill say its unusual but I like it<br />
<br />
On my skin Im not getting any creamy scent or coconut. The sweetness in the opening reminds me of fresh cut mulberries <br />
<br />
Then I can smell the figleaf. The sweet and herbaceous bitterness make a great contrast</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="3865"comment_id="2184300"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Diptyque/Philosykos-Eau-de-Parfum-3865.html?ccid=2184300#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent2183002" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(250,247,236,0.86);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:0,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:null}"></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1708924">yes2heaven</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2024-06-09">06/09/24 10:28</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>ohh, I wanted to like this so badly. loved the greenness of the opening (respect for leaning towards fig leaf instead of fig pulp), but it very quickly faded into a powdery-coconutty-woody scent that I truly did not care for. Notably poor longevity and sillage for an edp, after the first 15 minutes of wear it's completely indistinguishable from any other cedar fragrance on the market, unremarkable overall :(</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="3865"comment_id="2183002"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Diptyque/Philosykos-Eau-de-Parfum-3865.html?ccid=2183002#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent2181980" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(247,244,242,0.73);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:5,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:1,&quot;summer&quot;:1,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:1,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:2,&quot;sillage&quot;:1,&quot;gender&quot;:&quot;unisex&quot;,&quot;relation&quot;:null}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="5"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1829411">cloudynight</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2024-06-08">06/08/24 08:48</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>The green fig is so refreshing and then it kicks in with the creamy coconut for a lovely combination. I love the scent but the performance is dreadful. Intimate sillage and only lasts 2, MAYBE up to 4, hours at best. I've been on the lookout for a strong dupe but from what I have read the fig in this seems unmatched. Full bottle seems like a waste of money even if I got a deal on it.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="3865"comment_id="2181980"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Diptyque/Philosykos-Eau-de-Parfum-3865.html?ccid=2181980#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent2180050" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(255,253,234,0.8);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:1,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:null}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="1"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc2177570" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="tanaC"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/75237"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.75237.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="tanaC" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma2177570ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck0x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd2177570" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(247,244,242,0.81); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/75237">tanaC</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2024-06-04">06/04/24 06:41</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>Philosykos EDP<br />
(Store test, skin test)<br />
<br />
 I have never have strong bond with Diptyque<br />
As a brand (even I collect like 6 of them..) wried, <br />
But I have been brought or tested almost all brands offerings.<br />
<br />
Diptyque imho, is easy to forget, to overlook.<br />
Due to it natural uncomplicated profile, plain scent arrangement. <br />
Its up and down cycle for me.<br />
<br />
I think you can come to love Diptyque when <br />
you wants sweet spot of natural x performance in your collection.<br />
<br />
If I have tested Philosykos year ago. <br />
I think I wont like it due to green note, as of now. I like most of green scent.<br />
<br />
Philosykos friend of fig tree now reminds me of sweet party under the fig tree, sweet creamy sandalwood like at base. Creamy - Latonic sweetness that pleasing.<br />
<br />
I personally found similarity to Santal Moassi, the Hermes scent that I own, but that one is slightly more masculine.<br />
<br />
Philosykos is true unisex or I can be weekend scent. it is peaceful and joyful.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="3865"comment_id="2177570"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Diptyque/Philosykos-Eau-de-Parfum-3865.html?ccid=2177570#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent2176651" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(255,253,234,0.72);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:1,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:1,&quot;sillage&quot;:1,&quot;gender&quot;:&quot;unisex&quot;,&quot;relation&quot;:null}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="1"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; It's greener and lusher, less fruity, coconut is more detectable too. A delicious variation on one of my favorite fragrances ever. Such a great choice for the summer, super wearable! I will get a full bottle at some point for sure.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="3865"comment_id="2175423"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Diptyque/Philosykos-Eau-de-Parfum-3865.html?ccid=2175423#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent2172550" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(250,249,251,0.78);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:0,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:null}"></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; Maybe I'm just dramatic, but I can't see how this can be a flattering scent for anyone.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="3865"comment_id="2172550"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Diptyque/Philosykos-Eau-de-Parfum-3865.html?ccid=2172550#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent2167854" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(249,249,243,0.89);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:4,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:3,&quot;sillage&quot;:2,&quot;gender&quot;:&quot;female_unisex&quot;,&quot;relation&quot;:null}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="4"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc2167854" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="bellalandia"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/2091211"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.2091211.gif" class="comments-avatar"alt="bellalandia" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Regime-des-Fleurs/Himitsu-72664.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.72664.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Himitsu"title="Himitsu"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma2167854ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck0x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd2167854" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(249,249,243,0.89); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/2091211">bellalandia</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2024-05-25">05/25/24 17:54</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>Very delicious, realistic fig/peach scent. I really like this one. <br />
Imagine green garden, full of trees and bushes with sweet, little berries. There is lots of different kinds of plants of Mediterranean origin. Sun is shining and you are living in a nice home, getting ready to spend the whole day in your garden with a simple book in your hand. Breeze is touching your hair strands and you lay down under your favourite fig tree. One falls on you and you proceed to eat it with a smile on your face. You smell it and you know you are loving the nature. <br />
This is one take. The other one would be about you starring in call me by your name. This fragrance screams Italy in 90 where life was just a bit easier. <br />
Amazing work. Very realistic fruitiness and a tiny bit of sweetness. It is clearly a green fragrance as you can smell garden in this one little bottle. It is more of grassy-tree note rather than colourful flowers. Very sophisticated and delicious.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="3865"comment_id="2167854"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Diptyque/Philosykos-Eau-de-Parfum-3865.html?ccid=2167854#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent2164709" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(254,252,238,0.73);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:5,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:1,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:1,&quot;night&quot;:1,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;have&quot;}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="5"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc2164709" class="cell small-2" ><div ><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="jjx"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1419831"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.1419831.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="jjx" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Jo-Malone-London/Myrrh-Tonka-42027.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.42027.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Myrrh & Tonka"title="Myrrh & Tonka"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma2164709ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck1x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd2164709" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"><div class="flex-child-shrink" style="background: rgba(254,252,238,0.73); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1419831">jjx</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2024-05-22">05/22/24 17:38</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>A very wearable and refreshing scent. Sad that it doesnt last more than a few short hours. Thats why I layer the parfum version with the solid balm. Its supposed to be figs but all I can smell is peaches for some reason.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="3865"comment_id="2164709"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Diptyque/Philosykos-Eau-de-Parfum-3865.html?ccid=2164709#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent2162373" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(250,247,236,0.72);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:4,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:null}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="4"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc2162373" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="JustasL"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1591936"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.1591936.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="JustasL" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Creed/Viking-41698.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.41698.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Viking"title="Viking"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma2162373ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck2x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd2162373" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(250,247,236,0.72); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1591936">JustasL</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2024-05-20">05/20/24 15:02</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>This fragrance captures the essence of freshly cut grass, fig, and coconut perfectly. The coconut here is hyper-realistic, with a very nutty quality as if you're smelling not only the pulp but also the outside of the coconut shell.<br />
I genuinely love this scent. it's as unisex as it gets.<br />
It would be a love, if it projected better and had better longevity. Nevertheless, its a delightful scent thats hard to imagine anyone disliking.<br />
<br />
Rating: 7.5/10. For me, its definitely bottle-worthy, even if the score might suggest otherwise.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="3865"comment_id="2162373"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Diptyque/Philosykos-Eau-de-Parfum-3865.html?ccid=2162373#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent2158390" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(250,249,251,0.88);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:3,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:1,&quot;gender&quot;:&quot;female&quot;,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;had&quot;}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="3"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc2158390" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="maritimesunset"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1968310"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.1968310.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="maritimesunset" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma2158390ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck1x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd2158390" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(250,249,251,0.88); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1968310">maritimesunset</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2024-05-16">05/16/24 16:24</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>On my skin, opening smells exactly like biting into an unripe apricot - wonderful. After a few minutes, the coconut comes out, and scent settles into a nice natural coconut/fig scent with a little green sap. I was a little surprised by how much of this stuff I had to apply in order to pick up the way it smelled; I'm not a "beast mode" fragrance person but this came across as especially watered down. The coconut was so strong on me that the vibes were almost...tropical? There was a high-class soap or candle feel to it as well. Anyway, this would be a hard one to hate - it's safe, pleasant, and tastefully executed. Probably not adventurous enough for my usual taste, but I did find it nice.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="3865"comment_id="2158390"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Diptyque/Philosykos-Eau-de-Parfum-3865.html?ccid=2158390#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent2151960" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(247,244,242,0.88);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:5,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:1,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:1,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:3,&quot;sillage&quot;:1,&quot;gender&quot;:&quot;female_unisex&quot;,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;have&quot;}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="5"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc2151960" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="boredzoi"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1440284"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/himg/o.69247.png" class="comments-avatar"alt="boredzoi" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Maison-Martin-Margiela/By-the-Fireplace-31623.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.31623.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="By the Fireplace"title="By the Fireplace"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma2151960ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck3x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd2151960" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(247,244,242,0.88); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1440284">boredzoi</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2024-05-10">05/10/24 13:52</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>You know that moment when you go break a small branch off of a tree only to find that it's still green, and while you're slowly peeling it apart you're hit with that sharp, dewy, almost peppery smell? That's Philosykos. It makes me feel like a little kid running around the creek, looking for the perfect fresh vines to weave into crowns. It sticks very close to the skin, but it fades fairly quickly- after a full workday it had worn off entirely.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="3865"comment_id="2151960"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Diptyque/Philosykos-Eau-de-Parfum-3865.html?ccid=2151960#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent2147762" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(247,244,242,0.8);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:3,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:3,&quot;sillage&quot;:2,&quot;gender&quot;:&quot;female_unisex&quot;,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;had&quot;}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="3"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc2147762" class="cell small-2" ><div ><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="inariver2000"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/2119044"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.2119044.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="inariver2000" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma2147762ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck0x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd2147762" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"><div class="flex-child-shrink" style="background: rgba(247,244,242,0.8); My skin pulls the coconut right to the front of this fragrance, covering up any green or fresh notes. I end up with a creamy coconut accord and a hint of fig that fades to cloying by hour 2. Its okay but not what Im looking for. Wish the cedar, green, and fig leaf notes   actually came through and stuck around.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="3865"comment_id="2147762"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Diptyque/Philosykos-Eau-de-Parfum-3865.html?ccid=2147762#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent2142838" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(250,247,236,0.79);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:5,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:1,&quot;summer&quot;:1,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;had&quot;}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="5"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; Smells good in the bottle but on my skin it smells like babydoll plastic and then just nothingness. I would expect more longevity at this price point.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="3865"comment_id="2142812"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Diptyque/Philosykos-Eau-de-Parfum-3865.html?ccid=2142812#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent2141760" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(255,253,234,0.88);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:3,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:1,&quot;summer&quot;:1,&quot;autumn&quot;:1,&quot;day&quot;:1,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:&quot;unisex&quot;,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;want&quot;}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="3"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; If you really really love this smell and can spear ~150 you should totally get it. I will probably finish it quickly and wont repurchase it.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="3865"comment_id="2139741"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Diptyque/Philosykos-Eau-de-Parfum-3865.html?ccid=2139741#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent2137583" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(255,253,234,0.87);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:3,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:1,&quot;summer&quot;:1,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:1,&quot;sillage&quot;:1,&quot;gender&quot;:&quot;female_unisex&quot;,&quot;relation&quot;:null}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="3"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1686969">Cherylray14</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2024-04-26">04/26/24 20:41</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>I bought a decant because I love fig scents. Unfortunately, on me it doesn't smell like fig. The only note I get is cheap plastic. Luckily it faded after half an hour.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="3865"comment_id="2137583"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Diptyque/Philosykos-Eau-de-Parfum-3865.html?ccid=2137583#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent2137028" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(250,247,236,0.84);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:5,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:1,&quot;summer&quot;:1,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:1,&quot;night&quot;:1,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;have&quot;}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="5"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc2137028" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="daisypolo"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1701781"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.1701781.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="daisypolo" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma2137028ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck4x2"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd2137028" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(250,247,236,0.84); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1701781">daisypolo</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2024-04-26">04/26/24 08:30</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>This has been my signature scent since I was 18. It's just gorgeous. I don't know how much I can separate out the memories this conjures for me from an objective review of the fragrance itself, but I'll try. <br />
<br />
Worn best in the summer, especially on a hot evening in the city, Philosykos is a green fig tree dream. It is almost overwhelming in its luscious freshness and earthiness. Can, on clothing, smell a little like a very fresh gin and tonic with lime. I have received endless compliments wearing this, and although it's a popular and almost mainstream fragrance of Dyptique's, I hardly ever smell it on anyone else. It's never harsh, only heady, and conjures the image of being in a hot, damp forest. Beautiful to me, and reminds me of hot summer evenings spent in bars and roof terraces in London and New York.<br />
<br />
Smells like Unfinished Sympathy by Massive Attack</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="3865"comment_id="2137028"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Diptyque/Philosykos-Eau-de-Parfum-3865.html?ccid=2137028#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent2129780" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(250,247,236,0.77);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:4,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:1,&quot;summer&quot;:1,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:1,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:2,&quot;sillage&quot;:1,&quot;gender&quot;:&quot;unisex&quot;,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;want&quot;}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="4"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc2129780" class="cell small-2" ><div ><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="Despair"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1253246"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.1253246.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="Despair" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Guerlain/Black-Perfecto-by-La-Petite-Robe-Noire-45017.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.45017.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Black Perfecto by La Petite Robe Noire"title="Black Perfecto by La Petite Robe Noire"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma2129780ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck3x1"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd2129780" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"><div class="flex-child-shrink" style="background: rgba(250,247,236,0.77); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1253246">Despair</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2024-04-19">04/19/24 13:36</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>I wish I could give this a "love" instead of a "like", because it truly is a lovely scent. Such a green opening without being too sharp and a delicious drydown of juicy fig and creamy coconut. An absolutely dreamy, fruity and smooth scent but the longevity on me leaves a lot to be desired. If I can find a way to make this last longer on me, I will probably purchase a full bottle but for now, it's not quite up to my longevity standards.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="3865"comment_id="2129780"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Diptyque/Philosykos-Eau-de-Parfum-3865.html?ccid=2129780#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent2129000" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(255,253,234,0.8);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:0,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:null}"></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc2129000" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="sean.ovan"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/2088472"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.2088472.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="sean.ovan" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma2129000ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck0x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd2129000" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(255,253,234,0.8); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/2088472">sean.ovan</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2024-04-18">04/18/24 19:06</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>I usually hate fig, but this is very nice. It is rounded out really well by the warmer coconut note, but it doesn't smell like coconut at all. Very green, but not in the sharp herby way a lot of 90s colognes are (does not smell like cut grass or broken plant stems). <br />
<br />
As it dries down it's a little sweet - I think I'm just describing what a fig smells like lol. I love this, but to me it gives more fall vibes which I think contradicts what people are saying here. Maybe it's just how I associate plant / woodier base scents that aren't floral. Also very unisex.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="3865"comment_id="2129000"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Diptyque/Philosykos-Eau-de-Parfum-3865.html?ccid=2129000#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent2128269" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(250,249,251,0.83);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:5,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:1,&quot;summer&quot;:1,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:1,&quot;night&quot;:1,&quot;longevity&quot;:3,&quot;sillage&quot;:2,&quot;gender&quot;:&quot;unisex&quot;,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;have&quot;}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="5"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc2128269" class="cell small-2" ><div ><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="eleas94"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1510108"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/himg/o.69247.png" class="comments-avatar"alt="eleas94" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Diptyque/Philosykos-Eau-de-Parfum-3865.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.3865.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Philosykos Eau de Parfum"title="Philosykos Eau de Parfum"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma2128269ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck1x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd2128269" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"><div class="flex-child-shrink" style="background: rgba(250,249,251,0.83); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1510108">eleas94</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2024-04-18">04/18/24 05:47</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>I have been covering this perfume for over a year and finally am able to buy a full bottle! I'm not usually a fan of green scents, as they tend to be too sharp for me. This one is at first, but the coconut in this really rounds it out for me after a minute or two.<br />
I found this to be most beautiful on war summer days and evenings. It wears beautifully in the heat. I have a feeling I'll be wearing this all spring and summer.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="3865"comment_id="2128269"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Diptyque/Philosykos-Eau-de-Parfum-3865.html?ccid=2128269#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent2126854" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(254,252,238,0.88);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:4,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;had&quot;}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="4"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc2126854" class="cell small-2" ><div ><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="mooooo"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/2068697"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.2068697.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="mooooo" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma2126854ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck4x2"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd2126854" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"><div class="flex-child-shrink" style="background: rgba(254,252,238,0.88); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/2068697">mooooo</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2024-04-16">04/16/24 17:22</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>smells like a fig tree, but who tf wants to smell like a tree     ...apparently I do, every day</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="3865"comment_id="2126854"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Diptyque/Philosykos-Eau-de-Parfum-3865.html?ccid=2126854#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent2122148" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(250,247,236,0.87);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:5,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:1,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:1,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:3,&quot;sillage&quot;:2,&quot;gender&quot;:&quot;female_unisex&quot;,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;have&quot;}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="5"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc2122148" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="Jefferson_starkid"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1385319"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.1385319.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="Jefferson_starkid" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Malin-Goetz/Leather-67401.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.67401.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Leather"title="Leather"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma2122148ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck1x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd2122148" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(250,247,236,0.87); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1385319">Jefferson_starkid</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2024-04-12">04/12/24 02:16</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>Well here I am, a self-proclaimed fig note hater, making everyone I meet smell me wherever I go since I got the sample.<br />
This is fresh spring in a bottle. Not floral at all, more like the scent of the broken off stem of a plant you just picked. The front room of a plant shop where all the plants are in large water buckets and you think the scent might hurt your nose for a second but then it dissipates, and leaves only a creamy soft, slightly woody smell behind.<br />
<br />
As a person who usually goes for fresh (not floral) in the spring/summer, and woody in the autumn/winter, I find this absolutely lovely. I now also got the solid version, which comes in the most gorgeous little box with a spring garden painted on it. Im not saying that is a huge part of the appeal, but it doesnt hurt.<br />
Philosykos is a strong contender to take over first place from Herms Un Jardin sur le Toit as my favourite springtime scent and I am not mad about it at all.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="3865"comment_id="2122148"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Diptyque/Philosykos-Eau-de-Parfum-3865.html?ccid=2122148#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent2115680" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(254,252,238,0.81);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:0,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;have&quot;}"></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; Green, fruity and slightly woody in the background to ground it and provide depth. And green. If you like green perfumes, then this is for you.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="3865"comment_id="2109815"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Diptyque/Philosykos-Eau-de-Parfum-3865.html?ccid=2109815#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent2108994" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(247,244,242,0.81);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:1,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:null}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="1"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; I LOVE fig in perfume but this was just disgusting. Really disappointed.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="3865"comment_id="2108994"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Diptyque/Philosykos-Eau-de-Parfum-3865.html?ccid=2108994#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent2103931" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(248,249,236,0.77);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:5,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:1,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:1,&quot;night&quot;:1,&quot;longevity&quot;:4,&quot;sillage&quot;:2,&quot;gender&quot;:&quot;female_unisex&quot;,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;have&quot;}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="5"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc2103931" class="cell small-2" ><div ><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="gecko_emoji"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1942747"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.1942747.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="gecko_emoji" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Montale/Chocolate-Greedy-2186.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.2186.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Chocolate Greedy"title="Chocolate Greedy"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma2103931ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck2x2"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd2103931" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"><div class="flex-child-shrink" style="background: rgba(248,249,236,0.77); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1942747">gecko_emoji</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2024-03-25">03/25/24 13:45</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>This is a perfect green scent. Really leafy and fresh but stopped from being overwhelmingly so by the sweet fig note. Smells very realistically like a fig tree, bark, branches, leaves, figs and all. I find it really grown up, elegant and mature without leaning old! Lasts intimately on skin for the whole day, only really radiates outwards beyond that for the first few hours. Quite expensive but the bottle is huge!</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="3865"comment_id="2103931"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Diptyque/Philosykos-Eau-de-Parfum-3865.html?ccid=2103931#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent2097821" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(250,249,251,0.7);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:3,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:1,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:null}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="3"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc2097821" class="cell small-2" ><div ><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="OneSnifWonder"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/2064470"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.2064470.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="OneSnifWonder" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Floral-Street/Wild-Vanilla-Orchid-47212.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.47212.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Wild Vanilla Orchid"title="Wild Vanilla Orchid"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma2097821ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck1x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd2097821" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"><div class="flex-child-shrink" style="background: rgba(250,249,251,0.7); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/2064470">OneSnifWonder</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2024-03-19">03/19/24 18:43</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>If you have ever snapped a young tree stem in half in the spring, that is exactly what the opening on this scent smells like. When it says green, it means GREEN. If you are an outdoorsy person, this may appeal to you but I didn't personally envision any occasion in which I'd want to smell like freshly picked tree leaves (as lovely as I do find that smell when I'm outside!)</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="3865"comment_id="2097821"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Diptyque/Philosykos-Eau-de-Parfum-3865.html?ccid=2097821#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent2097296" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(250,245,242,0.71);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:5,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:1,&quot;summer&quot;:1,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:1,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:3,&quot;sillage&quot;:2,&quot;gender&quot;:&quot;unisex&quot;,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;have&quot;}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="5"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc2097296" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="Johnny Madison"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1889501"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.1889501.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="Johnny Madison" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Andrea-Maack/Soft-Tension-39036.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.39036.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Soft Tension"title="Soft Tension"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma2097296ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck2x2"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd2097296" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(250,245,242,0.71); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1889501">Johnny Madison</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2024-03-19">03/19/24 09:09</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>Somehow this is the only fragrance in my collection that garners consistent compliments. It's a green, woody fig that can lean creamy in the EDT and more photorealistic in the EDP. It's extremely likable, happy and can make a below zero Midwestern winter afternoon seem Summer like. This is an iconic fig fragrance for a reason, and some may call it boring, but I find it to be the perfect homage to the fig tree. It's not a juicy overly sweet fig (like Maison Louis Figue Nouvelle), or a cozy warm fig (like Gris Charnel or The Noir), but a sunny uplifting fig true to its nature form. <br />
This really does remind me of a summer holiday in Greece or anywhere in the Mediterranean in fact. It's freedom, unwinding, and leisure in a bottle and it really does lift my spirits every time I dress myself in it. <br />
I have Debaser and Parisian Musc in my collection as well, which are siblings to Philosykos, but I feel they will never fully embody the timelessness of the fig note that Philosykos has captured in the perfume industry. <br />
Do you like fig? This is one of the easiest blind buys.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="3865"comment_id="2097296"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Diptyque/Philosykos-Eau-de-Parfum-3865.html?ccid=2097296#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent2096163" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(255,253,234,0.84);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:5,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:1,&quot;summer&quot;:1,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:1,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;have&quot;}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="5"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc2096163" class="cell small-2" ><div ><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="incat"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1984380"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.1984380.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="incat" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Maison-Martin-Margiela/Soul-Of-The-Forest-41185.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.41185.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Soul Of The Forest"title="Soul Of The Forest"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma2096163ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck2x2"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd2096163" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"><div class="flex-child-shrink" style="background: rgba(255,253,234,0.84); def gonna buy a bottle &lt;3</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="3865"comment_id="2096163"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Diptyque/Philosykos-Eau-de-Parfum-3865.html?ccid=2096163#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent2095049" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(248,249,236,0.82);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:0,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:1,&quot;summer&quot;:1,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:1,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:3,&quot;sillage&quot;:2,&quot;gender&quot;:&quot;unisex&quot;,&quot;relation&quot;:null}"></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; This is the most divine, luxurious unisex scent for me. It has the elegant, delicate scent of slightly green Figs and the rich taste of Coconut. Um, imagine you have a bowl of Coconut milk ice cream for dessert, and you drop Figs in it. It sounds funny but its scent is very luxurious and classy. I just want to smell it forever, this must be the scent that best represents the Quiet luxury style, I will definitely buy it as soon as possible.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex;
