padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1340562">MyAlabasterJar</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2023-12-02">12/02/23 11:15</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>I adore this scent, takes me to Crete every time. Full lush fig trees of Greece. Milky, creamy, spicy green fig. All of the fig tree, the woodness of the branches, crisp green of the leaves, creamy coconutty fig milk and then hit with the sweet full bodied flesh. Love love love.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="3865"comment_id="1990632"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Diptyque/Philosykos-Eau-de-Parfum-3865.html?ccid=1990632#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1986500" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(250,245,242,0.79);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:0,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:null}"></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc1986500" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="Hell&auml;mieli"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1715744"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.1715744.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="Hell&auml;mieli" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Gucci/Memoire-d-une-Odeur-56096.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.56096.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Mmoire dune Odeur"title="Mmoire dune Odeur"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma1986500ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck0x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd1986500" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(250,245,242,0.79); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1715744">Hell&auml;mieli</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2023-11-27">11/27/23 09:41</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>I went to a perfume store to try this. First sniff - nah, boring. Didn't understand the hype. Next day I was emptying the paper bag in which I've tossed receits &amp; stuff after my shopping day. I was wondering what is that heavenly, coconutty &amp; woody scent that rose from the bag. Found a perfume test strip, but couldn't remember, what was it. 'Blind-sniffing' it again and again, I realised I truely love it. But when I remembered what it was, I immediately got the image of Nordic-30-yr-old Byredo user working in an advertising agency. And then I recognized the resemblance with Bal d'Afrique - which is not bad (BA is lovely), but too popular and kind of 2015's. So now I'm struggling if this is going to be a classic for me to wear, or is it's popularity just a shooting star of 2010's.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="3865"comment_id="1986500"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Diptyque/Philosykos-Eau-de-Parfum-3865.html?ccid=1986500#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1984304" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(250,249,251,0.75);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:5,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:1,&quot;summer&quot;:1,&quot;autumn&quot;:1,&quot;day&quot;:1,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:3,&quot;sillage&quot;:2,&quot;gender&quot;:&quot;unisex&quot;,&quot;relation&quot;:null}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="5"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc1984304" class="cell small-2" ><div ><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="cloudfruit"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1617661"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.1617661.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="cloudfruit" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Serge-Lutens/Dans-Le-Bleu-Qui-Petille-74024.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.74024.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Dans Le Bleu Qui Ptille"title="Dans Le Bleu Qui Ptille"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma1984304ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck0x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd1984304" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"><div class="flex-child-shrink" style="background: rgba(250,249,251,0.75); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1617661">cloudfruit</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2023-11-24">11/24/23 13:39</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>clean, mature, bright, creamy, green, sweet, woody, beautiful, confident, interesting, intelligent. it's not a mindbreaking experience but it's just so nice. like trader joe's it's not the end all be all but it serves it's purpose</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="3865"comment_id="1984304"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Diptyque/Philosykos-Eau-de-Parfum-3865.html?ccid=1984304#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1983631" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(250,245,242,0.75);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:4,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:1,&quot;sillage&quot;:1,&quot;gender&quot;:&quot;unisex&quot;,&quot;relation&quot;:null}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="4"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc1983631" class="cell small-2" ><div ><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="Wraithmanxiv"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1504977"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.1504977.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="Wraithmanxiv" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Xerjoff/XJ-1861-Naxos-30529.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.30529.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="XJ 1861 Naxos"title="XJ 1861 Naxos"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma1983631ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck0x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd1983631" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"><div class="flex-child-shrink" style="background: rgba(250,245,242,0.75); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1504977">Wraithmanxiv</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2023-11-23">11/23/23 13:53</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>Im amazed at the realistic scope of this scent, smells like you just trekking in the wild and not taking a clear path, instead taking the bushy path. But all in all, i dont wanna smells like that</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="3865"comment_id="1983631"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Diptyque/Philosykos-Eau-de-Parfum-3865.html?ccid=1983631#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1979543" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(254,252,238,0.83);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:1,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:3,&quot;sillage&quot;:2,&quot;gender&quot;:&quot;unisex&quot;,&quot;relation&quot;:null}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="1"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc1979543" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="Delrey2002"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1838871"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.1838871.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="Delrey2002" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Michael-Kors/Midnight-Shimmer-38989.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.38989.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Midnight Shimmer"title="Midnight Shimmer"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma1979543ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck1x2"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd1979543" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(254,252,238,0.83); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1838871">Delrey2002</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2023-11-18">11/18/23 10:19</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>I was DISAPPOINTED to say the least , by this perfume. I love fig as a note scent and have other perfumes with fig, but this one didn't smell like a fig perfume, rather than a fig tree. The fig itself as a fruit was not prominent, it smells like this appalling smell of the fig leaves and branches, like when you accidentally touch the leaves and they leave that spur and weird smell and you have to wash your hands afterwards. Clearly a unisex scent, but in my personal opinion this should not be what a perfume smells like.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="3865"comment_id="1979543"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Diptyque/Philosykos-Eau-de-Parfum-3865.html?ccid=1979543#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1978182" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(250,249,251,0.72);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:4,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;want&quot;}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="4"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc1978182" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="theblondegourmand"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1895562"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.1895562.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="theblondegourmand" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma1978182ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck0x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd1978182" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(250,249,251,0.72); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1895562">theblondegourmand</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2023-11-16">11/16/23 12:45</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>Being relatively new to fragrance, this was the first perfume I smelled that actually smelled like something real in nature. This smells like the most realistic juicy, tart, fig. In the opening, there is a greenness that reminds me of the smell of chlorophyll on your hands after rubbing leaves between your fingers. The dry down is more juicy fig with a tiny hint of coconut creaminess. <br />
<br />
I continue to go back and smell the tester strip I sprayed this on and cannot get enough. I am contemplating a full bottle but given the price point and other people's experiences with poor-longevity, I am on the fence.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="3865"comment_id="1978182"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Diptyque/Philosykos-Eau-de-Parfum-3865.html?ccid=1978182#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1977872" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(254,252,238,0.83);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:0,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:null}"></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc1977872" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="SalinasL"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1192461"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/himg/o.69247.png" class="comments-avatar"alt="SalinasL" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Oscar-de-la-Renta/So-de-la-Renta-3261.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.3261.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="So de la Renta"title="So de la Renta"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma1977872ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck3x2"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd1977872" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(254,252,238,0.83); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1192461">SalinasL</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2023-11-16">11/16/23 06:36</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>Am I the only one who always mistakes those figs for an ultrasound of a baby on the label? (Ok, Ill keep the rest of my Rorschach inkblot confessions to myself...)<br />
This is a very pleasant fig scent. Juicier and a bit spicier than Premier Figuier. The actual fig note remains prominent for longer. PF is milkier and has a more prominent nutty/coconut note, and is an overall more interesting and more pleasant scent to me (bearing in mind that I love a lactonic note and coconut and asafoetida). Philosykos totally reminds me of EA Green Tea Fig. In my experience any perfume that really showcases fig is probably going to be on the weaker side, and I dont see much difference between these scents in that regard. For me, Premier Figuier is an all-time love, while Philosykos is a strong like but not different enough from the much cheaper Arden fig.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="3865"comment_id="1977872"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Diptyque/Philosykos-Eau-de-Parfum-3865.html?ccid=1977872#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1977250" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(255,253,234,0.82);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:4,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:1,&quot;sillage&quot;:1,&quot;gender&quot;:&quot;female&quot;,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;have&quot;}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="4"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; AT ALL.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="3865"comment_id="1977250"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Diptyque/Philosykos-Eau-de-Parfum-3865.html?ccid=1977250#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1973549" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(247,244,242,0.85);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:3,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:1,&quot;summer&quot;:1,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:1,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:2,&quot;sillage&quot;:1,&quot;gender&quot;:&quot;unisex&quot;,&quot;relation&quot;:null}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="3"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc1973549" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="akronik96"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1629860"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.1629860.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="akronik96" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma1973549ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck1x2"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd1973549" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(247,244,242,0.85); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1629860">akronik96</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2023-11-10">11/10/23 14:08</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>Fig is probably one of my favourite notes, if not the favourite note, so It's logical to think Philosykos is one of my favourite perfumes, right? WRONG!<br />
This is fine, it's ok but nothing more than that. Now I get the idea, because you cant use the natural raw materials of fig because they are toxic, the goal was to artificially create something that smells plain natural, and yes they nailed it. Bravo, but please step aside now, we want to enjoy something more exiting that has fig in it, for the simple smell of the figs I can go smell the tree, don't need a 180 perfume.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="3865"comment_id="1973549"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Diptyque/Philosykos-Eau-de-Parfum-3865.html?ccid=1973549#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1972547" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(247,244,242,0.89);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:4,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:1,&quot;summer&quot;:1,&quot;autumn&quot;:1,&quot;day&quot;:1,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:3,&quot;sillage&quot;:2,&quot;gender&quot;:&quot;female_unisex&quot;,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;have&quot;}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="4"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc1972547" class="cell small-2" ><div ><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="AinoKaroliina"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1810813"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.1810813.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="AinoKaroliina" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma1972547ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck1x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd1972547" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"><div class="flex-child-shrink" style="background: rgba(247,244,242,0.89); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1810813">AinoKaroliina</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2023-11-09">11/09/23 10:28</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>I sense the coconut immediately when I spray this on and I love it. Lovely sweetness from the fig that isn't overpowering as there are the green accords accompanying it. For me, I feel this is borderline too green, but the coconut note keeps it from crossing that line.<br />
<br />
Very different and interesting for me. Strong projection with just a light spraying.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="3865"comment_id="1972547"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Diptyque/Philosykos-Eau-de-Parfum-3865.html?ccid=1972547#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1970582" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(250,249,251,0.88);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:4,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:1,&quot;summer&quot;:1,&quot;autumn&quot;:1,&quot;day&quot;:1,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:2,&quot;sillage&quot;:1,&quot;gender&quot;:&quot;unisex&quot;,&quot;relation&quot;:null}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="4"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc1970582" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="sylvividi"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1859679"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.1859679.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="sylvividi" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma1970582ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck2x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd1970582" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(250,249,251,0.88); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1859679">sylvividi</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2023-11-07">11/07/23 00:43</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>Smells very similar to Philosykos EDT, but more green and full-bodied. The EDP is more vegetal, more heavy forests; less creamy fig or strong fresh coconut. I thought I would like this in theory, but in practice I prefer the EDT more.<br />
<br />
As a longevity note: my skin must be unusual because the performance of the EDP is much worse than the EDT on me. I get maybe 1.5 hours where I can smell the EDP projecting, and another hour of skin scent, and then it's basically gone.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="3865"comment_id="1970582"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Diptyque/Philosykos-Eau-de-Parfum-3865.html?ccid=1970582#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1968121" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(255,253,234,0.75);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:5,&quot;winter&quot;:1,&quot;spring&quot;:1,&quot;summer&quot;:1,&quot;autumn&quot;:1,&quot;day&quot;:1,&quot;night&quot;:1,&quot;longevity&quot;:3,&quot;sillage&quot;:2,&quot;gender&quot;:&quot;unisex&quot;,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;have&quot;}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="5"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc1968121" class="cell small-2" ><div ><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="jkndressage"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1882797"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.1882797.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="jkndressage" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma1968121ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck1x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd1968121" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"><div class="flex-child-shrink" style="background: rgba(255,253,234,0.75); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1882797">jkndressage</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2023-11-03">11/03/23 19:33</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>This is my favorite perfume I've ever purchased. A friend bought it and let me try and I was just mesmerized. It's so very green and settles into a beautiful slightly floral, woody/earthy scent. On myself, I get hints of lily of the valley. It is not as long-lasting as I would wish and it is an investment up front but I am addicted.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="3865"comment_id="1968121"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Diptyque/Philosykos-Eau-de-Parfum-3865.html?ccid=1968121#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1966801" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(249,249,243,0.78);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:4,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:1,&quot;summer&quot;:1,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:1,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:2,&quot;sillage&quot;:2,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;have&quot;}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="4"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc1966801" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="Scratch &amp; Sniff"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1878218"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.1878218.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="Scratch &amp; Sniff" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma1966801ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck2x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd1966801" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(249,249,243,0.78); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1878218">Scratch &amp; Sniff</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2023-11-02">11/02/23 09:42</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>A few years ago, I was sitting on a bench in Rome during a blisteringly hot summer day.  Then, the scent of my perfume wafted through the air and I was treated to a refreshing mist of Philosykos.  Thats when I realizedI hadnt sprayed on any perfume that day.  I looked above my head and suddenly realized that Id taken refuge from the heat under a large fig tree, and I had mistaken the scent of the fig tree for Philosykos.  That afternoon mix-up is merely a testament to just how vividly this bottle is able to capture the essence of fig.<br />
<br />
This fragrance is the calming equivalent of a trip to the spa or to Italy itself, and is so aromatic that spraying it on your skin feels like the equivalent of biting into a fig while having the juice dribble down your chin.  They don't come any greener or fresher than this.  If this scent were a movie, it would be the sun-drenched gardens and chateau of Call Me By Your Nameexcept swap out the peach scene for a fig.<br />
<br />
Unfortunately, like summer itself, the scent doesnt last as long as youd hope for  I cant smell this on myself after an hour or two, and the sillage and longevity are incredibly weak.<br />
<br />
In five words or less: Call Me By Your Fig.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="3865"comment_id="1966801"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Diptyque/Philosykos-Eau-de-Parfum-3865.html?ccid=1966801#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1956448" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(250,245,242,0.86);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:5,&quot;winter&quot;:1,&quot;spring&quot;:1,&quot;summer&quot;:1,&quot;autumn&quot;:1,&quot;day&quot;:1,&quot;night&quot;:1,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:null}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="5"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc1956448" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="romanoff1701"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1435678"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.1435678.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="romanoff1701" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma1956448ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck1x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd1956448" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(250,245,242,0.86); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1435678">romanoff1701</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2023-10-19">10/19/23 23:36</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>I really enjoy wearing this fragrance. I love being outdoor and be able to smell the greenery. This fragrance does not only smell "green", it smells real. <br />
First you get a blast of some real green and in my opinion a bit of peach (even though it's not listed). Then comes the fig, followed by a coconut, a bit of a creamy coconut. But not in a cloying way. It's just beautifully crafted. It reminds me of Italy because it just smells so real. <br />
<br />
The drawback: Longevity and Sillage. While I do not need my fragrances to reach every nose in my vicinity, I would like to be able to smell it on my skin even after a few hours. Longevity and Village are pretty bad though. I will not replenish once my bottle is empty.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="3865"comment_id="1956448"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Diptyque/Philosykos-Eau-de-Parfum-3865.html?ccid=1956448#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1955103" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(254,252,238,0.87);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:1,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:null}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="1"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc1955103" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="Lillakilla"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1845621"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.1845621.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="Lillakilla" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Profumum-Roma/Dulcis-in-Fundo-3890.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.3890.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Dulcis in Fundo"title="Dulcis in Fundo"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma1955103ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck1x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd1955103" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(254,252,238,0.87); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1845621">Lillakilla</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2023-10-18">10/18/23 10:24</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>The scent of this turns my stomach so fast. Very, very intense fig which goes right to the sinuses/temples to induce a tension headache and nausea. On the other hand, I don't know that I've smelled this on anybody other than me, so it must be not so bad to encounter it out in the world. Still, if it's on my skin, it's unbearable. Like being trapped in a hot car on a humid day with rotting fruit. Like standing next to a tuba blasting in your ear. Need a cold compress and a dark room after this one.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="3865"comment_id="1955103"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Diptyque/Philosykos-Eau-de-Parfum-3865.html?ccid=1955103#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1954315" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(254,252,238,0.79);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:0,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;have&quot;}"></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc1954315" class="cell small-2" ><div ><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="astralmonad870"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1555935"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.1555935.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="astralmonad870" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Dries-Van-Noten/Jardin-de-L-Orangerie-72594.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.72594.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Jardin de L'Orangerie"title="Jardin de L'Orangerie"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma1954315ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck1x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd1954315" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"><div class="flex-child-shrink" style="background: rgba(254,252,238,0.79); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1555935">astralmonad870</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2023-10-17">10/17/23 11:57</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>To me this smells like green bananas. I prefer Matiere Premiere Parisian Musc for a richer nuttier and woodier fig coconut</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="3865"comment_id="1954315"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Diptyque/Philosykos-Eau-de-Parfum-3865.html?ccid=1954315#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1948507" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(255,253,234,0.82);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:0,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:null}"></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc1948507" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="dieu17"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1381366"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/himg/o.69247.png" class="comments-avatar"alt="dieu17" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma1948507ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck2x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd1948507" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(255,253,234,0.82); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1381366">dieu17</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2023-10-10">10/10/23 09:58</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>Back in the summer of 2020 when I was traveling across the South of France, we stopped by an island near Marseille, and there was this majestic fig tree standing there, swaying in the wind, its emerald green leaves glittering underneath the glaring rays of the Mediterranean sun. A thick, almost opalescent liquid of the sap started to ooze as I plucked one of its leaves and brought it closely to my nose, and that was the time when I experienced the greenness, the richness of the fig tree. Luckily, youll never have to travel to a Mediterranean region to relish that wonderful concoction that Mother Earth has to offer, instead, Diptyque did it well when capturing the essence of the greenery in the bottle of Philosykos.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="3865"comment_id="1948507"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Diptyque/Philosykos-Eau-de-Parfum-3865.html?ccid=1948507#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1947384" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(250,249,251,0.87);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:5,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:1,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:3,&quot;sillage&quot;:1,&quot;gender&quot;:&quot;unisex&quot;,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;want&quot;}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="5"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc1947384" class="cell small-2" ><div ><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="OtherPeople&#039;sChildren"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1781367"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.1781367.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="OtherPeople&#039;sChildren" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Atelier-Materi/Cacao-Porcelana-57099.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.57099.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Cacao Porcelana"title="Cacao Porcelana"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma1947384ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck1x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd1947384" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"><div class="flex-child-shrink" style="background: rgba(250,249,251,0.87); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1781367">OtherPeople&#039;sChildren</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2023-10-08">10/08/23 18:02</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>Garden-fresh fig, plus a beautiful green note. Wears nicely, the vegetal nature mellowing out and the fig becoming sweeter and juicier as it sits on the skin. Lasts moderately long for a fruity, green freshie. About 4 plus hours of wear.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="3865"comment_id="1947384"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Diptyque/Philosykos-Eau-de-Parfum-3865.html?ccid=1947384#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1946872" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(248,249,236,0.8);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:2,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:null}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="2"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc1946872" class="cell small-2" ><div ><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="maidenhead"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1858782"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.1858782.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="maidenhead" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Kerosene/Unknown-Pleasures-17438.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.17438.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Unknown Pleasures"title="Unknown Pleasures"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma1946872ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck1x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd1946872" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"><div class="flex-child-shrink" style="background: rgba(248,249,236,0.8); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1858782">maidenhead</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2023-10-08">10/08/23 00:47</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>i go crazy for a photorealistic fruit scent, but this was actively repulsive. i guess i get fig, but maybe the coconut and fig leaf notes are turning me off?</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="3865"comment_id="1946872"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Diptyque/Philosykos-Eau-de-Parfum-3865.html?ccid=1946872#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1937280" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(249,249,243,0.87);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:4,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:null}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="4"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc1937280" class="cell small-2" ><div ><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="Anglix"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1193533"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.1193533.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="Anglix" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Parfums-de-Marly/Pegasus-16938.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.16938.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Pegasus"title="Pegasus"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma1937280ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck0x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd1937280" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"><div class="flex-child-shrink" style="background: rgba(249,249,243,0.87); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1193533">Anglix</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2023-09-25">09/25/23 17:26</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>Very similar to Fico di Amalfi, but Fico is fresher and blended with more citruses while Philosykos is greener, smells more like the fig tree. Coconut seems to appear in the drydown, but just a tiny hint and almost unnoticeable. For the price and the juicier nature I would prefer Fico di Amalfi.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="3865"comment_id="1937280"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Diptyque/Philosykos-Eau-de-Parfum-3865.html?ccid=1937280#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1934310" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(249,249,243,0.73);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:3,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:null}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="3"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc1934310" class="cell small-2" ><div ><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="Duckling"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1774366"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/himg/o.69247.png" class="comments-avatar"alt="Duckling" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Diptyque/Orpheon-Eau-de-Parfum-65738.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.65738.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Orphon Eau de Parfum"title="Orphon Eau de Parfum"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma1934310ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck2x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd1934310" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"><div class="flex-child-shrink" style="background: rgba(249,249,243,0.73); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1774366">Duckling</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2023-09-22">09/22/23 03:18</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>Realistic fig tree, including fruit, leaves, stem and sap. Unique, yet inoffensive.<br />
<br />
I dont want to smell like a fig tree though.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="3865"comment_id="1934310"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Diptyque/Philosykos-Eau-de-Parfum-3865.html?ccid=1934310#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1932740" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(255,253,234,0.83);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:5,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:1,&quot;summer&quot;:1,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:1,&quot;night&quot;:1,&quot;longevity&quot;:4,&quot;sillage&quot;:2,&quot;gender&quot;:&quot;unisex&quot;,&quot;relation&quot;:null}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="5"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc1932740" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="jlaurw"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1843740"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/himg/o.69247.png" class="comments-avatar"alt="jlaurw" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma1932740ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck1x2"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd1932740" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(255,253,234,0.83); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1843740">jlaurw</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2023-09-20">09/20/23 09:48</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>I'm so happy I found this scent and the performance on my skin is excellent. This is very similar to Tokyo Milk Marine Sel. On first spray it is slightly overwhelming. I mean it really smells powerfully like standing next to a fig tree after a good rain. I get a huge amount of dirt and leaves on the nose, but the dry down for me is fabulous. Upon dry down it becomes a very fresh dirt and moss scent with just a slight hint of leaves and a tiny bit of fig fruit skin. The transformation into a dirt scent makes this smell nearly identical to Marine Sel on my skin. The only note missing is that salt note which I loved with Marine Sel as it rounded out the extreme greenness and earthiness well but Philosykos is so close and for me the performance on my skin would make this worth the cost of the EDP.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="3865"comment_id="1932740"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Diptyque/Philosykos-Eau-de-Parfum-3865.html?ccid=1932740#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1920203" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(248,249,236,0.71);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:5,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:1,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:1,&quot;night&quot;:1,&quot;longevity&quot;:2,&quot;sillage&quot;:2,&quot;gender&quot;:&quot;unisex&quot;,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;have&quot;}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="5"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc1920203" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="Babakaz"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1418523"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.1418523.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="Babakaz" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma1920203ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck2x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd1920203" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(248,249,236,0.71); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1418523">Babakaz</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2023-09-05">09/05/23 07:56</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>|Philosykos - Diptyque|<br />
<br />
Background:<br />
<br />
I first smelled this perfume from a sample I received from one of the perfume stores I order from. I had no idea about what the perfume was or how it should have smelled. I fell in love with it from the first spray.<br />
<br />
A lot of perfumes might take a while for your nose to appreciate their nuances, but this one is so simple and well-blended that I couldn't get enough of it from the first sniff. I haven't encountered even a single person who ever disliked or complained about the smell of this perfume. <br />
<br />
Smell:<br />
<br />
The scent, to my nose, is fresh and green; yet, very creamy. It's not so green that you feel like you're in a jungle. It doesn't entirely smell fruity either. You get hints of the fig pods (fruit), but for the most part, I smell the branches, leaves, and the tree. It's like standing next to a fig tree as opposed to the smell you get when you open up a fig to eat. This makes the smell much more approachable and, in my opinion, way classier. I also get hints of coconut. Black pepper is also listed as a note, but I can't really pick up much of it, but that might just be my nose.<br />
<br />
I also need to mention that I find philosykos a very headache fiendly perfume. Even if you overspray, the nature of the perfume is in a way that it wont be bothering anyone.<br />
<br />
Longevity, Sillage:<br />
<br />
I have the perfume concentration, and I can't really vouch for either sillage or longevity. I get around 2 or a maximum of 3 hours of wear, and it sits quite close to the body. However, I see this as something you would wear for yourself just for the pure joy of it. I've already gone through half a bottle in only 2 years of wear; considering that I haven't ever used this as my daily fragrance.<br />
<br />
Who is it for?:<br />
<br />
For me, this is a very practical option that you can technically wear at any time. Daytime, nighttime; casual or formal; it just works. It can also be pulled off by almost any man or woman. It's very neutral in its masculinity; which I quite enjoy. The only thing is that it won't have enough power for the winter; so I count it as a summer-only perfume.<br />
<br />
Smell: 10/10<br />
Uniqueness: 8/10<br />
Masculinity: 5/10<br />
Longevity: 3/10<br />
Silage: 5/10</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="3865"comment_id="1920203"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Diptyque/Philosykos-Eau-de-Parfum-3865.html?ccid=1920203#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1919665" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(255,253,234,0.79);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:4,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:1,&quot;summer&quot;:1,&quot;autumn&quot;:1,&quot;day&quot;:1,&quot;night&quot;:1,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:&quot;unisex&quot;,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;have&quot;}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="4"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc1919665" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="kayqin"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/228322"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/himg/o.69247.png" class="comments-avatar"alt="kayqin" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Diptyque/Eau-Rose-14214.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.14214.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Eau Rose"title="Eau Rose"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma1919665ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck2x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd1919665" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(255,253,234,0.79); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/228322">kayqin</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2023-09-04">09/04/23 14:32</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>I'm quite new to my "sniffing things obsessively" journey but I already know I'm fascinated by fig leaf scents. However, many I've smelled are not wearable for me because the fig leaf - especially realistic just-snapped fig leaf and twig like this one - is always too sharp, acrid, too green. Philosykos is a revelation because the sharp tangy fig leaf is tempered with this gorgeous creamy undertone - I think it's mostly the coconut. I love the soft coconutty dry-down - it works beautifully with my skin, it blends in and doesn't just smell "like perfume." I would seriously consider wearing this in real life, perhaps on holiday or on those hot London days.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="3865"comment_id="1919665"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Diptyque/Philosykos-Eau-de-Parfum-3865.html?ccid=1919665#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1915184" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(248,249,236,0.79);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:0,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:null}"></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc1915184" class="cell small-2" ><div ><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="Kpeachy"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1826496"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.1826496.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="Kpeachy" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma1915184ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck0x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd1915184" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"><div class="flex-child-shrink" style="background: rgba(248,249,236,0.79); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1826496">Kpeachy</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2023-08-30">08/30/23 06:21</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>It is a beautifully crafted scent. But, I am not crazy by this scent. <br />
I can appreciate it on my skin. I normally dislike coconut in my fragrance but coconut scent in this is not sickening/rich.<br />
Its natural and balanced by freshness. I feel cozy and luxurious when I wear it.<br />
I am not entirely sure if Ill get a bottle of it.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="3865"comment_id="1915184"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Diptyque/Philosykos-Eau-de-Parfum-3865.html?ccid=1915184#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1914003" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(255,253,234,0.77);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:5,&quot;winter&quot;:1,&quot;spring&quot;:1,&quot;summer&quot;:1,&quot;autumn&quot;:1,&quot;day&quot;:1,&quot;night&quot;:1,&quot;longevity&quot;:4,&quot;sillage&quot;:3,&quot;gender&quot;:&quot;unisex&quot;,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;have&quot;}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="5"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc1914003" class="cell small-2" ><div ><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="Eman Gheba"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1627349"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.1627349.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="Eman Gheba" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma1914003ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck2x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd1914003" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"><div class="flex-child-shrink" style="background: rgba(255,253,234,0.77); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1627349">Eman Gheba</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2023-08-28">08/28/23 21:18</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>If I had to keep one fragrance for the rest of my lifethis would be it. The most beautiful nostalgic fragrancefig tree in a bottle with some coconut nuances.this fragrance is poetic. I can write a whole essay on this fragrance thats how much I love it.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="3865"comment_id="1914003"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Diptyque/Philosykos-Eau-de-Parfum-3865.html?ccid=1914003#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1913840" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(247,244,242,0.75);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:0,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;have&quot;}"></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc1913840" class="cell small-2" ><div ><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="astralmonad870"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1555935"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.1555935.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="astralmonad870" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Dries-Van-Noten/Jardin-de-L-Orangerie-72594.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.72594.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Jardin de L'Orangerie"title="Jardin de L'Orangerie"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma1913840ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck0x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd1913840" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"><div class="flex-child-shrink" style="background: rgba(247,244,242,0.75); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1555935">astralmonad870</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2023-08-28">08/28/23 17:01</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>Philosykos is basically a combination of Fico di Amalfi's freshness and greenness with a bit of the creaminess from Matiere Premiere's Parisian Musc. The EDP is stronger in smell than EDT, as it should be, but does not have much of a difference in scent. I already own Parisian Musc as well as BDK Gris Charnel which is like a boozier version of PM or Philosykos but glad I got this anyway as my husband also loves it. Needed a bottle for him!</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="3865"comment_id="1913840"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Diptyque/Philosykos-Eau-de-Parfum-3865.html?ccid=1913840#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1912679" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(247,244,242,0.7);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:2,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:1,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:1,&quot;day&quot;:1,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:3,&quot;sillage&quot;:1,&quot;gender&quot;:&quot;male_unisex&quot;,&quot;relation&quot;:null}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="2"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc1912679" class="cell small-2" ><div ><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="Bregondo"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1593456"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.1593456.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="Bregondo" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Ard-Al-Zaafaran/Al-Dirgham-87214.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.87214.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Al Dirgham"title="Al Dirgham"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma1912679ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck1x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd1912679" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"><div class="flex-child-shrink" style="background: rgba(247,244,242,0.7); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1593456">Bregondo</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2023-08-27">08/27/23 07:47</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>Smells like leaves and grass, like some sort of herbal tea. Unusual and unorthodox smelling for a perfume, it's not pungent though. Not my type of fragrance, no doubt not mass-appealing. Doesn't last long and stays close to the skin. It's the type of fragrance that you wear for your own pleasure.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="3865"comment_id="1912679"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Diptyque/Philosykos-Eau-de-Parfum-3865.html?ccid=1912679#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1908849" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(248,249,236,0.83);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:3,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:null}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="3"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc1908849" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="Catherine_Smells"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1290625"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/himg/o.69247.png" class="comments-avatar"alt="Catherine_Smells" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma1908849ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck0x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd1908849" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(248,249,236,0.83); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1290625">Catherine_Smells</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2023-08-22">08/22/23 14:35</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>The scent of a leafy fig tree heavy with fruit, over ripe fruit that will soon fall and begin to rot on the warm earth below. Drifting into a soft coconut breeze that feels more refreshing than the usual cloying coconut - more a coconut water, than a coconut cream.<br />
<br />
A beautiful, unique fragrance. Unfortunately the vegetative quality of the scent disagrees with me, and I feel it getting stuck in my throat.<br />
<br />
Edit: lightbulb moment for me - I enjoy fig for home fragrances, but I do not want to smell like a fig.
