            </div>
</div>
</div><div class="tabs-panel" id="popular-positive-reviews"><div class="cell">
    <div class="strike-title"><span>Most Popular Positive Reviews</span></div>
    <div class="grid-x grid-padding-x grid-margin-y" style="position: relative; padding: 0 0.25rem 0 0.25rem;">
                            <div id="parent1288702" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(250,245,242,0.82);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:5,&quot;winter&quot;:1,&quot;spring&quot;:1,&quot;summer&quot;:1,&quot;autumn&quot;:1,&quot;day&quot;:1,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:null}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="5"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc1288702" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="perfumesniffer"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/20321"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.20321.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="perfumesniffer" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma1288702ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck7x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd1288702" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(250,245,242,0.82); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/20321">perfumesniffer</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2021-02-07">02/07/21 14:31</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>This is The One that started it all. <br />
<br />
It was probably around 2002. I was still living in Boston, young, early career and broke. My signature scent at the time was mostly Givency Amarige and sometimes Mugler Angel in the winter. I always loved perfume but tended to have 2-3 max. One day I was in Neimans in the Copley mall and stumbled upon the Diptyque section. Loved the bottles and aesthetics! I think Philosykos cost about $88 for the largest size at this time and I thought it was SO expensive. After sniffing Philosykos, perfume was to become an obsession for me. I was used to perfumes smelling like 80s-90s mainstream designer stuff; mostly synthetic and like perfume. Philosykos was a whole scene, a whole experience, so new and different. I was mesmerized by Philosykos. Figs, leaves, branches, the whole freaking tree! I left Neimans with that bottle thinking it was so pricey I wouldnt be able to eat the rest of the month. I loved wearing every spritz of that bottle. Thank you, Diptyque, and thank you Olivia Giacobetti, for making this amazing fragrance. </p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="3865"comment_id="1288702"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Diptyque/Philosykos-Eau-de-Parfum-3865.html?ccid=1288702#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent273679" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(249,249,243,0.89);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:5,&quot;winter&quot;:1,&quot;spring&quot;:1,&quot;summer&quot;:1,&quot;autumn&quot;:1,&quot;day&quot;:1,&quot;night&quot;:1,&quot;longevity&quot;:3,&quot;sillage&quot;:2,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;have&quot;}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="5"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc273679" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="SuperUltraFabulous"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/255082"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/himg/o.69247.png" class="comments-avatar"alt="SuperUltraFabulous" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Guerlain/Aqua-Allegoria-Ginger-Piccante-53805.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.53805.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Aqua Allegoria Ginger Piccante"title="Aqua Allegoria Ginger Piccante"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma273679ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck7x2"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd273679" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(249,249,243,0.89); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/255082">SuperUltraFabulous</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2012-08-05">08/05/12 16:46</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>Give yourself a hug.<br />
<br />
<br />
With this EDT, its warm, loving, natural, comforting, and even joyful. In fact, Ive been giddy all day since wearing it; it just makes you happy.<br />
<br />
The opening is the damp soil, the soft grey bark of the Ficus carica and its green, pubescent leaves. But its all about the fruits, the hard green figs that become sumptuous and ripe, a glaucous deep purple with a tear of syrup at the ostiole. These figsbeckoning you to pluck them from the treeare only a spray or two away.<br />
<br />
Notes:<br />
<br />
 The largest volume is 100ml / 3.4oz for $120. I feel this price is good for the complexity and quality of the fragrance.<br />
<br />
 No headaches, rashes, or sensitivities to report.<br />
<br />
 Completely natural. NO SYNTHETIC NOTES!<br />
<br />
 For me, the intro is green, and you get the soil, and the leaves and the bark.<br />
<br />
 The fragrance then gets sweeter but never cloying. <br />
<br />
 The drydown is very soft and comforting, some men may feel this is feminine. I recommend the fewest amount of sprays to avoid this? <br />
<br />
 Over-spraying will result in a very slight metallic sheen to the figs in the drydown that youll detect if your doing a lot of nose-to-wrist business (which you will).<br />
<br />
 It lasts a very long time on meall day. <br />
<br />
 I feel positive and happy wearing this. Your cheeks will ache from smiling so much.<br />
<br />
 Perfect for day, summer. Appropriate in the evening, summer. Potentially appropriate for fall, even winter. <br />
<br />
 The drydown is also creamy which adds to this fragrances trans-seasonal potential.<br />
<br />
 As a man, I dont feel sexy per se, but the creamy drydown alludes to these possibilities. (But dont buy this just for sexy-time).<br />
<br />
 Appropriate for a man and woman. Young and old.<br />
<br />
 Mood: casual. Attire: casual. Not for work days at PriceWaterhouseCoopers or similar venues. <br />
<br />
I just purchased this fragrance so I will perform more tests in the near future, performing various activities, indoors and out, hot and cold days, on clothes or on the skin.<br />
<br />
 Projection is still being determined.<br />
<br />
I have samples of James Heeleys Figuier, LArtisan Parfumeur Premier Figuier (EDT), and Hermess Un Jardin en Mediterranee. I will do a comparison soon too.<br />
<br />
Enjoy!<br />
<br />
(my first review)</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="3865"comment_id="273679"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Diptyque/Philosykos-Eau-de-Parfum-3865.html?ccid=273679#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent374101" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(250,249,251,0.82);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:4,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:1,&quot;sillage&quot;:1,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;had&quot;}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="4"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc374101" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="freddinos"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/42597"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.42597.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="freddinos" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma374101ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck7x2"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd374101" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(250,249,251,0.82); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/42597">freddinos</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2013-06-06">06/06/13 04:45</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>Having grown up in a rural area of Greece,I was surrounded by fig trees in my parents' orchard. I remember late August-early September, when the figs started to ripen and it was time to pick them. My brother and I always ate loads,fresh from the tree, and enjoyed watching my grand mother making fig preserve with the bucketloads that remained. This is what Philosykos is to me: a late August afternoon, picking figs from the tree, smelling the green fig leaves close to my nose and the lingering scent on my hands afterwards. I couldn't wear this perfume in my hometown, simply because everyone would think I'm just coming from fig picking. In the urban, nature deprived life that I live now though, Philosykos is an olfactory journey to those days. When fig leaf wasn't a perfume and figs never tasted better...</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="3865"comment_id="374101"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Diptyque/Philosykos-Eau-de-Parfum-3865.html?ccid=374101#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent133758" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(247,244,242,0.75);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:4,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:null}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="4"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc133758" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="alfarom"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/37900"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.37900.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="alfarom" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Serge-Lutens/Gris-Clair-593.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.593.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Gris Clair"title="Gris Clair"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma133758ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck7x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd133758" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(247,244,242,0.75); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/37900">alfarom</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2011-03-15">03/15/11 06:12</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>I used to think James Heeley's Figuer was one of the best Fig scents around but then I tried Phylosikos. Tremendously realistic. It opens with an incredibly green fig leaves note immediately surrounded by fruits aromas and a milky-feeling. Absolutely perfect for spring/summer daywear. In italy the word Fig (translated Fico or Figo) can be used also as an adjective to describe someone who's a very dynamic, charming, awesome and beautiful person. It's kind opposite to NERD. So I can easily say thath when you wear Phylosikos you feel like the most "Fig" in town!<br />
<br />
In my personal rating Heeley's Figuer is still a little (very little) step ahead from Phylosikos because I prefer a tarter interpretation of the theme but you should give this one a chance and you won't be disappointed.<br />
<br />
Rating: 8/10</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="3865"comment_id="133758"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Diptyque/Philosykos-Eau-de-Parfum-3865.html?ccid=133758#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent676421" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(247,244,242,0.78);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:5,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:1,&quot;summer&quot;:1,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:1,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;have&quot;}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="5"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc676421" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="Cerulean"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/515489"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.515489.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="Cerulean" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Serge-Lutens/Jeux-de-Peau-11350.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.11350.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Jeux de Peau"title="Jeux de Peau"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma676421ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck6x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd676421" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(247,244,242,0.78); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/515489">Cerulean</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2016-02-11">02/11/16 06:02</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p><br />
<br />
The most natural smelling representation of a fig tree. Uplifting, evocative of memories and undeniably elegant and top notch quality.<br />
<br />
When I was really young, in the late 90s, me and my family went on holiday to a Greek island, where we met a friendly family there. One of the days we spent there, and I remember it as if it was yesterday, we were all day at the beach until the sun turned orange, then we all went to a little white stone tavern by the shore. The mom of the friendly family sprayed Philosykos before we sat on the table, and we were all mesmerised. Imagine an elegant blond woman, wearing a simple striped blue-white nautical dress above her swimsuit, with a green fresh aura around her. Three years ago when I encountered Philosykos again without knowing that I've smelled it before, it all came back to me, as if I was reliving that moment. Magnificent what a scent can do to one's brain. <br />
<br />
If only the longevity was improved, it would earn one more star from me! <br />
I have tried both the EDT and the EDP. I preferred the EDT in terms of scent as it was more green to my nose and also, I found the longevity of both similar. It is completely unisex, so guys don't be wary of it.<br />
<br />
I encourage everyone to try it and experience how suburbia in Greece smells on an August day.<br />
<br />
Linear, natural and unique.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="3865"comment_id="676421"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Diptyque/Philosykos-Eau-de-Parfum-3865.html?ccid=676421#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div>                            <reviews-infinity :random-colors="[&quot;#fefcee&quot;,&quot;#faf7ec&quot;,&quot;#f9f9f3&quot;,&quot;#f8f9ec&quot;,&quot;#fffdea&quot;,&quot;#faf9fb&quot;,&quot;#faf5f2&quot;,&quot;#f7f4f2&quot;]" :perfume-id="3865" sentiment="positive"></reviews-infinity>
            </div>
</div>
</div><div class="tabs-panel" id="popular-negative-reviews"><div class="cell">
    <div class="strike-title"><span>Most Popular Negative Reviews</span></div>
    <div class="grid-x grid-padding-x grid-margin-y" style="position: relative; padding: 0 0.25rem 0 0.25rem;">
                            <div id="parent1074272" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(254,252,238,0.71);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:2,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:null}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="2"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc1074272" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="17seyed"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1165604"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.1165604.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="17seyed" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma1074272ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck6x1"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd1074272" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(254,252,238,0.71); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1165604">17seyed</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2019-06-29">06/29/19 00:44</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>"Yo dawg I heard you like figs. So I made a perfume with fig leaves, fig tree sap, fig fruit, and with pictures of figs on the bottle".<br />
<br />
If you've grown up near a fig tree like me, you've probably been told not to go very near the tree because the leaves and the figs can make your body incredibly itchy. Needless to say, I had my little misadventures near the lovely fig tree. Followed by a thorough scrubbing under the shower from my mother.<br />
<br />
This is such a realistic and 1:1 recreation of fig that my body phantom pains the itchiness to itself when I put it on.<br />
<br />
Personally it's not really my cup of tea. I'm not a fan of ultra natural smelling fragrances in general. But hey if the "Yo dawg" statement above applies to you, by all means go ahead and enjoy Philosykos!</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="3865"comment_id="1074272"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Diptyque/Philosykos-Eau-de-Parfum-3865.html?ccid=1074272#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent141120" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(250,247,236,0.71);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:2,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;had&quot;}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="2"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc141120" class="cell small-2" ><div ><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="OlfractalInfemme"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/30529"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.30529.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="OlfractalInfemme" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma141120ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck5x2"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd141120" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"><div class="flex-child-shrink" style="background: rgba(250,247,236,0.71); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/30529">OlfractalInfemme</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2011-04-20">04/20/11 11:32</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>One of the most unusual fig fragrances out there. Imagine a fig on a dark sandy beach right about to be hit by lightening. No heart, no soul, no emotion but just that moment in its transient naked ionized anticipation.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="3865"comment_id="141120"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Diptyque/Philosykos-Eau-de-Parfum-3865.html?ccid=141120#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent898596" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(255,253,234,0.86);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:2,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:1,&quot;sillage&quot;:1,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;had&quot;}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="2"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc898596" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="tatajean"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1110757"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.1110757.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="tatajean" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Xerjoff/XJ-1861-Naxos-30529.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.30529.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="XJ 1861 Naxos"title="XJ 1861 Naxos"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma898596ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck4x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd898596" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(255,253,234,0.86); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1110757">tatajean</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2018-01-08">01/08/18 23:30</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>Blind Buy.<br />
<br />
I got it recommended by a friend to try it out. Came to this page, saw people said it is similar to the "The Italian Fig", went to my local Body Shop and smelled it. I liked the smell of it on my skin but was not entirely sold. The next day I see a Philosykoks EDP on sale and said to myself that it might be a big upgrade so I did not know what to expect from it. I directly go with a blind buy because of the good price and good reviews here, I spray a bit on my neck and scarf. <br />
<br />
The scent disappeared after only one hour. Was a bit sad but I said maybe because of the cold weather outside. Once I got home sprayed before sleep and disappointed to say that the scent disappeared more quickly than I fell asleep. <br />
<br />
Tried again in the morning before work. Got only one hour out of it. I like the scent, it gives the feeling of "rustic" and takes back you back to a place where time stands still and the sun burns with passion. But the performance is very low on my skin and even clothes. Sillage is very soft on my skin and performance under one hour. Would not recommend for blind buy or for those who would like to stand a bit more out of the crowd. Keep this one for personal uses around the house or gardening.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="3865"comment_id="898596"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Diptyque/Philosykos-Eau-de-Parfum-3865.html?ccid=898596#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent528838" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(250,247,236,0.73);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:2,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:1,&quot;summer&quot;:1,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:1,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:2,&quot;sillage&quot;:1,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;had&quot;}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="2"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc528838" class="cell small-2" ><div ><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="shuuu"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/845528"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.845528.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="shuuu" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Yves-Saint-Laurent/Opium-Pour-Homme-Eau-de-Parfum-28179.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.28179.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Opium Pour Homme Eau de Parfum"title="Opium Pour Homme Eau de Parfum"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma528838ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck5x2"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd528838" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"><div class="flex-child-shrink" style="background: rgba(250,247,236,0.73); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/845528">shuuu</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2014-10-04">10/04/14 09:25</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>I'm a fig lover but i really don't like this one . <br />
<br />
This one is too realistic rather than wearable . The smells of dust ,fig and fig tree are strong , smells of coconut milk and fig are both very dull and boring here .  <br />
<br />
You would love it if you wanna be a movable fig tree </p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="3865"comment_id="528838"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Diptyque/Philosykos-Eau-de-Parfum-3865.html?ccid=528838#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent338909" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(250,249,251,0.77);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:2,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:1,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:1,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:null}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="2"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc338909" class="cell small-2" ><div ><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="Housebliss"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/299116"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.299116.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="Housebliss" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Prada/Infusion-de-Vetiver-2015-31042.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.31042.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Infusion de Vetiver (2015)"title="Infusion de Vetiver (2015)"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma338909ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck4x2"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd338909" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"><div class="flex-child-shrink" style="background: rgba(250,249,251,0.77); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/299116">Housebliss</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2013-02-23">02/23/13 08:22</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>No. I can't get past the initial blast of weeds. Not grass, but weeds. I remember smelling like this in kindergarten after I'd been rolling around in the bushes.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="3865"comment_id="338909"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Diptyque/Philosykos-Eau-de-Parfum-3865.html?ccid=338909#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div>                            <reviews-infinity :random-colors="[&quot;#fefcee&quot;,&quot;#faf7ec&quot;,&quot;#f9f9f3&quot;,&quot;#f8f9ec&quot;,&quot;#fffdea&quot;,&quot;#faf9fb&quot;,&quot;#faf5f2&quot;,&quot;#f7f4f2&quot;]" :perfume-id="3865" sentiment="negative"></reviews-infinity>
            </div>
</div>
</div><div class="tabs-panel" id="search-reviews"><search-perfume-reviews :perfume_id="3865":random-colors="[&quot;#fefcee&quot;,&quot;#faf7ec&quot;,&quot;#f9f9f3&quot;,&quot;#f8f9ec&quot;,&quot;#fffdea&quot;,&quot;#faf9fb&quot;,&quot;#faf5f2&quot;,&quot;#f7f4f2&quot;]"></search-perfume-reviews></div></div><foundation-tabs></foundation-tabs></reviews-wrapper></div><perfume-shortcut-menu :perfume_id="3865" when-hidden="#toptop"></perfume-shortcut-menu><initialize-status-data></initialize-status-data><div class="cell small-12"><!-- Tag ID: fragranticacom_perfume_footer -->

        <div class="cell small-4 medium-2 flex-container flex-dir-column">
        <div style="display: flex; align-items: start; text-align: start; line-height: 1.2em; height: 2.9em; overflow: hidden;">
        <span style="white-space: nowrap; color: lightsteelblue">1.&nbsp;</span>
        <span style="display: -webkit-box; -webkit-line-clamp: 2; -webkit-box-orient: vertical; overflow: hidden; text-overflow: ellipsis;">
            <a href="https://www.fragrantica.com/perfume/Lattafa-Perfumes/Khamrah-75805.html" class="en2inter">Khamrah Lattafa Perfumes</a>
        </span>
    </div>
            <div style="display: flex; align-items: start; text-align: start; line-height: 1.2em; height: 2.9em; overflow: hidden;">
        <span style="white-space: nowrap; color: lightsteelblue">2.&nbsp;</span>
        <span style="display: -webkit-box; -webkit-line-clamp: 2; -webkit-box-orient: vertical; overflow: hidden; text-overflow: ellipsis;">
            <a href="https://www.fragrantica.com/perfume/Jean-Paul-Gaultier/Le-Male-Elixir-81642.html" class="en2inter">Le Male Elixir Jean Paul Gaultier</a>
        </span>
    </div>
            <div style="display: flex; align-items: start; text-align: start; line-height: 1.2em; height: 2.9em; overflow: hidden;">
        <span style="white-space: nowrap; color: lightsteelblue">3.&nbsp;</span>
        <span style="display: -webkit-box; -webkit-line-clamp: 2; -webkit-box-orient: vertical; overflow: hidden; text-overflow: ellipsis;">
            <a href="https://www.fragrantica.com/perfume/By-Kilian/Angels-Share-62615.html" class="en2inter">Angels&#039; Share By Kilian</a>
        </span>
    </div>
            <div style="display: flex; align-items: start; text-align: start; line-height: 1.2em; height: 2.9em; overflow: hidden;">
        <span style="white-space: nowrap; color: lightsteelblue">4.&nbsp;</span>
        <span style="display: -webkit-box; -webkit-line-clamp: 2; -webkit-box-orient: vertical; overflow: hidden; text-overflow: ellipsis;">

        </span>
    </div>
            </div>
        <div class="cell small-4 medium-2 flex-container flex-dir-column">
            <div style="display: flex; align-items: start; text-align: start; line-height: 1.2em; height: 2.9em; overflow: hidden;">
        <span style="white-space: nowrap; color: lightsteelblue">5.&nbsp;</span>
        <span style="display: -webkit-box; -webkit-line-clamp: 2; -webkit-box-orient: vertical; overflow: hidden; text-overflow: ellipsis;">
            <a href="https://www.fragrantica.com/perfume/Xerjoff/XJ-1861-Naxos-30529.html" class="en2inter">XJ 1861 Naxos Xerjoff</a>
        </span>
    </div>
            <div style="display: flex; align-items: start; text-align: start; line-height: 1.2em; height: 2.9em; overflow: hidden;">
        <span style="white-space: nowrap; color: lightsteelblue">6.&nbsp;</span>
        <span style="display: -webkit-box; -webkit-line-clamp: 2; -webkit-box-orient: vertical; overflow: hidden; text-overflow: ellipsis;">
            <a href="https://www.fragrantica.com/perfume/Maison-Martin-Margiela/By-the-Fireplace-31623.html" class="en2inter">By the Fireplace Maison Martin Margiela</a>
        </span>
    </div>

<script  data-cfasync="false">
    // Check that service workers are supported
    if ('serviceWorker' in navigator) {
        // Use the window load event to keep the page load performant
        window.addEventListener('load', () => {
            navigator.serviceWorker.register('/service-worker.js?v=rtgFr7c4b6b084f801d1036ebe90095780be1');
        });
    }
</script>
